reviews.review: History looking down at you .. This magnificent piece of architecture is very central and around the narrow streets where there are many shops and restaurants. It is mainly something to take photographs of .

Another good view point. After hearing about the history of the square, it seemed the obvious thing to pay the €2.5 to visit the top of the tower.A lift takes you to the level of the clock mechanism and then you walk up a few flights of narrow stairs to reach the top.Your reward is a beautiful view over the square on one side and with the castle above and behind you. Very spacious up there and looked a lot less busy than the Santa Justa Tower which we could see from our vista.They could have improved the experience by giving more information about the clock and the tower in English.Certainly worth a visit.
Amazing view. Amazing view of downtown and the riverfront of Tejo; no qeues to enter to the clockroom or reach the viewpoint on top of the building; the price (2,50€) is reasonable.

Really beautiful, must see at night!. The arch is incredibly beautiful...especially at night when it's lit up. From Rua Augusta you can see the statue and the river behind the arch. From Parco Commercio on the other side of the arch you look down the magnificent street. In the summer months, at night they have an amazing light show shown on the façade of the arch and the building it's attached to. Now THAT is really spectacular but it doesn't run year around. There are a number of restaurants on the Parco Commercio so the arch is a fantastic setting for dinner (esp since it's lit up).

What a view. It's an iconic arch at the central point of Lisbon so to be able to go to the top was something I didn't want to miss. At 2-50 each it's an inexpensive trip there could be some more history but what there is is very interesting and when getting to the top the view is incredible

A MAGNIFICENT ARCH WITH EXCELLENT VIWE ON THE TOP.. One of the most beautiful and popular monuments in Lisbon. a genuine historical structure and an architecture masterpiece. and (especially) the view of the top is breathtaking! if you have the time (and pay the ticket!) don't miss to go up!

Wonderful looks of Praça do Comercio. The perfect place to have a wonderful look at the most visited place of Lisbon Praça do Comercio from its upper side and to take a photo sorrounded by the roofs of Lisbon.
Take a moment to look when walking through the Baxia. The Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta is close to the river and easy to see when walking around the city center in the lower town.
On the Way to Breakfast. Awesome structure, mimes and human statues abound around this feature, very interesting and lovely to walk to, by and through!!

Good city views. We visited this just before dusk so saw a good sunset over the main bridge in Lisbon. Access is by a lift and then stairs. The views of the city are excellent, and it is quite safe at the top.

1st time in Lisbon . Great view of center of town
Good place to catch trams , buses and mini taxis
Local artisans and vendors set up stands on weekends making it a great place to find souvenirs and gifts
Worth the money because of the view. The view from the Arch is phenomenal and really beautiful. You will get photos that otherwise wouldn't have been possible. I really liked it up there.

Very picturesque and a nice place to walk!. As we were out exploring the city on a Saturday, we gravitated to this area of town and found it to be picturesque and vibrant. There is a handicraft fair on Saturdays, and the streets have many musicians. Nice place to walk!
Cape Cod Blackie
Overwhelming. Great view with relaxing ocean view, overwhelmed with the place and a must see, you can use the hop on hop off to visit it, the hop on hop off is really useful and nice.

Great View - Not Obvious. We didnt know that you could go to the top of the arch. However, it was listed on the Lisboa Card, so we went. The view is wonderful of the town, square, castle, waterfront, and the statues. I would put this on the must do especially if you get the Lisboa card. We did the 48 hour Lisboa card, and this was one of the gratis options. Once at the top, you can also ring the bell and confuse all the tourists that have not benefited from going to the top of the arch. Enjoy the views !!
Photo stop. lots of people, couples getting wedding pictures done here with the magnificant plaza view. recommended meutermedia
beautiful start to the square. beautiful arc that tops of an amazing square, lots of beautiful views of the water and further up to stores and shopping.

Nice overview of Lisbon. If you want to soak up a good amount of history in one little stroll, this is the place for you. But if you aren't into that sort of thing this area is great for views and photo opportunities.

Loved it!. One side is the Commercial Plaza; the other leads to Rua Augusta the famous walking street in Lisbon. But this beautiful monumental arch just sings history and commands some great photos. Gotta see it.

"Triumphal!". This is a very nice arch and a true piece of history! You can see it from the Rua Augusta or directly from the square of the commerce. The € 2.50 that you pay to get here and enjoy the view both on the city and the ocean is it is pretty inexpensive. I guarantee you some spectacular photos. If you wait for the sunset it will be even more attractive!

A great view towards downtown area and praça do comércio!. Exceptional view over baixa and praça do comércio. Also very close to the castle and chiado. Fantastic view of squares streets in baixa.
Exceptional! Don't miss it!

Stunning arc!. If you manage to to take a walk all the way down towards the metro train you will see the subway train at the end of the restaurant area of downtown Lisbon. A stunning piece of architected and adds real heritage!

Only your eyes can tell you the story. Just go to Lisbon and enjoy. A beautiful structure by day and by night. A great display of different crafts and beautiful cafes to take the sun at any time of the day.

A beautiful Gateway. Everyday we seemed to begin or end our day here walking through the Arch to the Praca or the other way to do a little more shopping. It is so beautiful especially with the sunrise or sunset. Best time to visit is late afternoon when the crowds from the cruise ships have gone. If you get into Lisbon before 8pm come here to see a beautiful sunset and the city that looks to be shinning from the sun in places. This is a great place for photos if you have a zoom lens.
Beautiful arch. A nice Arch located in the city center, on one of the best areas to walk around and enjoy Lisbon nice buildings

A Must visit attraction. This attraction is a great starting point for views & to get your bearings of Lisbon's historical attractions . A real bargain at 2.5 euros and unlike the other attractions, no queues and no crowds. Great views especially on a sunny day like we had - highly recommended.

Why travel to Paris? The Arco Triunfal is right here - in Lisbon!. Why travel to Paris? The Arco Triunfal is right here - in Lisbon! So much art and architecture in one place - you may spend the whole day here!
Downtown Lisbon. Did a walk through the area, beautiful archetecture, the area beyond held many shops selling variety of goods.
Wonderful view from downtown. Must be place in Lisbon downtown. Way up will by elevator and stairs, the view from the top will compensate the effort

Well hidden gem. Only realised you could get up here by looking on TA.Ticket office is easy to find once you know to look. We went up around 11:00 am and there were only handful of others. Well worth it.

Great, breathtaking, must see. It large and beautiful. The statue is marvelous. The buildings exterior designs are craftsmanship at it's finest. The plaza is like looking at a mirror, both sides the same.

Hidden gem in an obvious place. This is a great little find in an obvious place, the entrance is just off the square but once you get up to the top the search was well worth it. Great views of the city!
Beautiful place!. Take some time to admire this area if you're ever around. The Arco do Triunfo is emblematic of the city and worth snapping a quick selfie in front of it!

Have to see it. Amazing Arc, so great details. Wonderful place to be. As it is in the heart of the city, you will not be able to skip it :D
One one important thing, our tour guide informed us that street that goes behind the arc is full of drug addicts and pickpockets, so be careful.

Beautiful arch with nice views from top. Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta is an absolutely beautiful arch to see when visiting Lisbon and it's perfectly on your way from Rua Augusta to Praca de Comercio. It costs 2.50€ to take an elevator up top to see the 360 degree view over Lisbon but the city offers many better viewpoints over the city so depending on your interest is not a real must to visit the top.

Go early for peaceful views. Really enjoyed this. The Arch opens at 9am and was still virtually empty when we climbed to the top around 9:30. Great views of the Plaza and the river. Entrance is included with the purchase of a Lisbon card and is definitely worth the trip to the top.

Great Views of the city. This has the story of the city on it. You can pay and go up to the top to get a good view of the city. Lisboa is very hilly but you will be able to see most of it from the top.
Great View!. Sits on a beautiful square on the water. Definitely climb up to see the view! Then walk around the the square/praca and check out the river.
Great area to be around.. Lots of restaurants and people around this area. It's a good site to get some great pics.Be wary of people trying to sell cocaine-laced marijuana to your teen.
Beautiful. Gorgeous view of the city, my favorite actually.I really recommend and it's quite affordable.There is a lift but you will always have to climb a few steps.

Impressive monument with splendid views. A very striking monument and - usefully - a lift/elevator - so that you don't have to walk all of the way up. It affords good views over the city and the Tagus.

Super view. Its a place to go. There is visits to the top, prepare to wait in line but its worth it, the view is amazing. Sometimes they made projections in the walls by night, if you are in Lisbon in that time, dont miss it.

More impressive than expected. Woaw! Approaching by descending the Rua Augusta, which is a must anyway, provides the best impression: the sea behind, the majestic architecture, and take the time to look into the side streets and, above all, the artistic pavement. Too lovely and impressive!
Introduction to Lisbon. It's a big arch, a nice arch,at the the end of a really busy restaurant and shopping avenue. Not quite the Arc de Triomph but it does its job. Great introduction to Lisbon.
Wonderful experience. A soberb view over Lisbon city and the other bank of Tagus river! Very good for shooting photos and selfies!!!!

Great views of the city. This quite new attraction is a must for the city visitors, as it offers great views of Praça do Comércio and the Baixa District. You can buy the combined ticket with the Lisbon Story Centre for 8€

It's an Arch !. As arches go it's an impressive one but similar to several others around the world. This overlooks a wide open square which has seating around the square attached to various cafes. Worth seeing if in the area and a nice place to enjoy a glass of Sangria
Not really worthy.... Just went up because included for free on my Lisbon card. Nice view of Praca do Comercio, but overall nothing really special.
Quick visit. It was fun to squeeze this in, we had the Lisbn Card so it was included. Is it worth 3.50, probably not, but not busy.

See on the way but not a destination. It's a nice photo op and cool to see if you happen to wander past. Maybe there's more history or backstory to this clock tower but without knowing it, it's kind of a spot you snap a pic and move on.

Views. An historic way to orientate yourself in this beautiful down town area of the city. There's a lift to take you most of the way to the top and a narrow staircase for the remaining floor to the top. Very simple but worth doing.
Nice example of Portugal arcitecture. this is a beautiful landmark not far from the water area. Nice place for pictures and people watching.

Triumphal arch as good as anywhere . The Arch is as good as the Arch de Triomphe in Paris or Wellington Arch in London and is positioned to welcome visitors arriving by ship so it is near to the coast leading into the shopping and eating heart of Lisbon.
Entrance of Praca do Comercio. A landmark or entrance of Praca do Comercio, a grand and elegant arch. Do walk around the area when you are strolling from Rossio to Praca do Comercio.

The arch. Lisbon has its own "arc de triomphe". It is nicely placed right at the entrance to the old city (Rua Augusta). Or if you are coming from the old city, you exit right into the esplanada by the river.

Well worth the visit despite being poorly advertised. I hear this is Lisbon's newest tourist attraction. The monumental arch is obviously visible from Praça do Comercio and Rua Augusta but you can now get tickets to climb to the top and take in the views. The tiny entrance is on the Rua Augusta side and easily missed as I never saw a queue there during our stay, probably as I never saw any advertising for it save for one website. Entrance is free with the Lisboa Card, otherwise entrance is €2.50 per adult which is pretty good value. The first part is accessible by a lift and the rest via the old spiral staircases which serviced the clock and other parts of the monument. Parts of the staircase can be dangerous for small children so make sure you're always holding on to them. Once at the top the parapet wall is high enough to ensure safety. Strollers must be left at the bottom by the ticket desk. There is a room on the way up where you can observe the clock's mechanism and there is limited interpretation. personally, I think it's a missed opportunity as it could include a lot more interpretation on the history of the arch, its construction and what it represents. The views at the top are brilliant. Some say you should see this instead of the Elevador de Santa Justa which also provides a brilliant view but its a different view so I'd still recommend you visit the Elevador in addition to the Arco. Overall a good value attraction which is yet to be discovered by the crowds. So shhh...
Very nice view of Lisbon. From the top os the arch and for a symbolic price you can have a pretty nice view of Lisbon and the old part of the city.

A great overview of Lisbon. Arco da Rua Augusta is a monument that offers a privileged view over Lisbon. It costs 2,5 euros to go up the elevator and check it out. It's worth it. The monument is beautifully crafted in stone. You can see my photos on my blog: http://vanessasenasousa.blogspot.pt/2016/08/arco-da-rua-augusta-e-praca-do-comercio.html
Much better than the lift. We have been advise by the hotel to go on top rather than the elevatore. Good advice, no queue, nice view and you feel like alone on top. I recommend.
Great view from the arch. . Free entrance with Lisboa Card. Enjoyable view over Rua do Augusta towards Praça Rossio, short tour up that can be a stop on your way to restaurant etc.
Nice area. walking around this area you are drawn to the historical architectures and the many different sights near the arco .

360º view over Lisboa. This monument is located next to Praça do Comércio, being himself a historical reference of Lisbon. The visit has cost 2.5€ per person (price for adults, is cheaper for children) and the experience is great. The way to the top of the building is made by elevator and stairs. The stairs are narrow and only allow the passage in one direction at a time, however the movement between floors is very well organized. When we got to the top, we have a fantastic surprise when we realize the fantastic 360º view over Lisbon, It is a place of obligatory passage in Lisbon, ideal for photographs. This monument is not suitable for people with motor disabilities. There is no near parking so you have to walk through Lisbon center to get there.
and you enter into La Praça do Comercio. Experience a walk in this old part of the Lisbon city and you will always remember it. It is really enchanting.

Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta. The top of the Arc , offers panoramic views of the city, To visit , the entrance to the monument is by Rua Augusta, by just a small door next to the arch. The ticket costs 2.5 euros. Access to the elevator that takes on the top floor. , You have to climb about 30 steps to reach the room where the clock is located. In this space was placed a sign in which he explains the history of the arc, since its construction in 1759 to its completion in 1875.From the top you can admire the Terreiro do Paco, with the newly restored equestrian statue of José I, the Baixa, the Cathedral, the São Jorge Castle and the Tagus, .

Beautiful views of Lisbon. Yet another spot for catching beautiful views of this amazing city. We had the Lisboa card which allows for free entry (otherwise, it's €2,50 for adults). They scan your card and provide you with a ticket. You have to insert the ticket into a turnstile to enter the elevator, and again as you leave (so don't misplace your ticket while at the top). The elevator takes you up to one level below the rooftop, and a small staircase takes you the rest of the way. Stunning views across the river as well as the city center, with Rua Augusta directly below. We went in the late afternoon and it was practically empty. The entrance is on Rua Augusta just before you cross the street to get to Praça do Comércio - if you're facing the plaza, it'll be on your left.

Superb . Catch the metro to terrio do paco and you will surface right on the square next to the arc. Beautiful view . The square itself has places to eat around the perimeter . Go though the arc and you will enter rows of shops with restaurant tables set out in between. Great choice for lunch
Nice views of the square. This is an easy place to visit at €2.50. There are some narrow stairs after the lift ride. There are good views of the square and the river.

Come here for pictures. come here for pictures and eat at the plaza. We stopped by here after visiting the Oceanarium, and strolled around the plaza, took pictures, and couldnt have been a perfect day. If its too sunny and hot during, then its better to come here late afternoon. The smell of fresh water and air, gives it a nice relaxing time
Beautiful architectural design. Walking throughout Lisban is a pleasure as most of the buildings are beautiful designed. As the Arc is aswell
Main Rue. The main road leading to the sea with plenty of shops and restaurants along side the car free pedestrianised area.

Another arc de triumph . It is placed in a nice place, in the back there is the Augusta street with lots of shops and Caffès and in the front of it the square and the river. Don't miss it and take some pictures there. Basically it on another arc like In each European city.

Great view from the sea side. Very picturesque Arch by the main pedestrian street. Go through it and see it from the side closest to the harbour. It's great, but beware of the shady characters that hang around near the plaza there.
Amazing structure !. It's an amazing structure full of art you will certainly notice while visiting the very famous Praça do Comércio

Steve C. Pretty much just another arch which is on the Rio Tejo. Also known as Praca do Comercio (Trade Square) and palace Square. It's by the departure point city bus and tram tours and boat tours cruising along the Rio Tejo.
Vasco do Gama is represented on the left and Pompal on the left.

Beautiful Arch. You can picture the crowds sending Vasco DaGama off on his explorations from this arch and square. Right in the heart of the historic district, surrounded by port wine shops, restaurants, souvenir shops and the main shopping area.

One of the best things we did!. Really cheap to get in and it has the best view of the rue Augusta. Great for orientating yourself with Lisbon. TIP: keep your ticket as bizarrely you need to scan it on the way OUT

Incredible Sculpture. I'm always amazed at the incredible skills of craftsmen from the past. This monument is no exception.It sits majestically opposite the entrance to the sea and acts as a reminder of the once powerful days of ocean explorers and seafaring sailors .Head towards the water, take your shoes and socks off (socks comment is for untrendy people only) and put those hot heels in the cold Atlantic waters. Let momentary shock ease you into heavenly calmness. It's what you deserve.

Well worth a look. This is beautiful to look at from the street, but is worth going up to the top it cost 2.50euros.You climb the winding staircase to the top of the Arco Triunfal and from there you get great views across the square and out to the river and inland over the city. You can see up to the cathedral and the Theatre and the castle.We enjoyed it very much.

Great Arch, just majestic!. This is a beautiful structure in the central part of Lisbon. On one side there is the waterfront with the Comercio Square in front of the river, and on the other is the beginning of a beautiful set of roads lined with all types of shops, from yummy cake shops to cafes, restaurants and many others. There are people everywhere, and all of this creates such a lovely atmosphere when you go out for a walk to enjoy the day or the evening. It is absolutely charming. The Arch is a symbolic structure expressing the city's gratitude for their ability to survive and in the end triumph and prosper, after the 1775 devastating earthquake. It's a symbol of re-birth and at the same triumph over adversity. As the Latin inscription on the Arch states: "The Virtues of the Greatest, that they may be a lesson to all, mark for eternity the grandeur of the Portuguese soul and its achievements throughout the ages". Excellent!

Avarage. Maybe i am just not the typical tourist, thisfeels just like a must do. If you could, just take a cab and have it drive by so you can cross it of your list. There is a lot of nice architecture on your way to costa da caparic if you take bus 161. Nice bridges, jeaus statue and more. Alot of beggers and different people asking you for money around the area.

Good place to admire Lisbon. Arch top we have a magnificent view of Lisbon and the Tejo River.
Its a good place to visit in sunny days!
Great view of the city. Just go and visit, it is really worth it. Cost are just 2,50 euro and you got a wonderful panoramic experience over the city, the square and shopping streets.

Great history!. Our tour guide shared the history of the arch and the waterfront and it's very interesting. Easy to find and central to everything. You can catch all the hop on buses, tram and tours here.
Take Jump Shot. In every icon of the city we visited, my better half always have a souvenir jump shot, this huge arch facing the promenade and enjoy the water with the view of Vasco Da Gama bridge.

Another Arch. This arch sits in a giant square but on the other side of the arch is the beginning of great shopping and Port and wine tasting. Once you take your picture of this arch, head through it and enjoy the wines.
Beautiful Architecture. This is a stunning thing to see, and well done to Lisbon to making sure these things are kept when times are so hard

Take a Selfie. One of those things you need to say you saw. But also a good place to get travel information nearby and a transport hub. Form here you can get to many other parts of Lisbon. There are museums near by. We stumbled on one the Museum of Money which is free and we normally never would have gone to.
The Gateway to Peace!. When you get to the city, go here first, have a seat, reflect and relax by the river, then you're set for the day!

Attractive arch structure at the end of Rua Augusta. This is a monumental arch entrance to Rua Augusta from Praca do Comercio in the city centre of Lisbon. You can see the triumphal arch structure conveniently while strolling along Rua Augusta or from the square. This monument was built to commemorate the city's recovery from the 1755 earthquake that devastated Lisbon. The arch was completed in 1875. From Rua Augusta, you see the backside of the arch which has a clock face surrounded by decorative relief. It is not as attractive from this location however, fromhere but you see the statue of King Jose I through the arch gap. This is nice for photographs. From the square you see the full spectrum of design that went into the arch's construction. Here you see six columns holding up the 30 metre tall structure, a relief of Portugal's Coat of Arms midway up the centre arch, as well as an allegorical arrangement of figures, three atop the centre arch which opens to Rua Augusta and one each upon the two side arches which form part of the walkway around the plaza at the north end. It is a nice overall composition worth a few clicks of your camera.
cocaine hash marijuana?. This place is very touristy. There are a lot of cool shops and the atmosphere is get. I seriously have never heard this so much in my life though cocaine hash marijuana?

The view is amazing!. Right in the city centre of Lisbon is this Arco Triunfal. We took the lift to go up and then the small stairs. When we were up on the rooftop with beautiful statues. One side overlooking the Praça do Comércio and the other side the small "high streets". Also a great view over the beautiful city.
The heart of Lisbon.. Spectacular square that leads you to either the waterside or the shopping district, with plentiful restaurants.

Very pretty area of the city. The monument is located in a nice part of the city, with a nice square (where sometimes there are artists selling very pretty hand-made souvenirs), and close to the ocean. Perfect place to relax after a day of sightseeing!

Magnificent!. This is one of the most beautiful of all of the triumphal arches in Europe. It really is beautiful on a day with sunny blue sky, the adjacent yellow walls really bring out the glorious qualities of the arch. Great entrance to a beautiful area of shopping and eating. I love this plaza. And the arch sets it off beautifully.
Nice Site. The arch is a great thing to see while in Lisbon. It's a quick visit to see. Great architectural arch.

You cannot avoid it. For those interested in the history of Lisbon there is no way of missing the Rua Augusta Arch, the entrance is only 2 € and no queue at all. Just rise over the city and looked at it from a bird's view. A nice experience.

Central Landmark. Whether you are interested in the history of the Arch or not, the gateway to the city of Lisbon, and the entrance to the grid area rebuilt after the 1755 earthquake, is a landmark and focal point that makes navigating around the city by foot easy. It opens onto the Rua Augusta on one side, a main shopping thoroughfare where you will find several well-known names mixed among local portugese shops, and the waterfront on the other.

Beautiful arch. This sits like some Arch de Triomphe, but rather than celebrating victory in war it represents an entryway to many splendid sites in Lisbon. For Lisbon's glorious past, it deserves to say hello to tourists in this pompous way.

Top of the Arc. We noticed there were people on the top of the Arco Triunfal on the Praca do Comercio and, after a little bit of searching found the entrance on the Rua Augusta. A lift takes you part way up the building and then you climb stone spiral staircases to the top.The views are some of the best in Lisbon, overlooking the main square and the river.

Entrance gate to the main square. This arch marks the entrance to the huge main square of the city, the Praca do Comercio. The arch itself is worth to stand and take a look at, it is beautiful and rich in details!

Climb to the top of the Arc! Great view!. I had walked under the arc a lot during the last few years and just recently found out you can also buy a ticket and get on top of it! A lift takes you half way up and there is a staircase to the very top (with staircase traffic ligths, because it's quite a small staircase)..Really nice view to the city, the square in front of it and to the river.
Praça do Comercio. This arch is included in the buildings that are in Praçca do Comercio. In the archs around the gate is located a flea market

Over rated city. There are some beautiful buildings but the whole city seems grubby and unloved. There seems to be a big drug problem, we were offered drugs on the street on countless occasions (and we are a mature couple) The public transport system is very good & easy to use, but feel the city is over rated and very expensive.
stunning entrance. This is one of the first things you see when you enter the town centre and is very impressive. It sets the tone for the city
Nice place to visit. Beautiful architectural design, nice path getting you to the concert squares onto the ocean, nice location

Two clear distinctive vantage points. Heading toward the arch is an incredible stroll down a street full of shops and cafes. Cross through slowly and enjoy the architectural details. On the other side you enter into a completely different world in one of Europe's largest squares and the waterfront. Stunning.

Go there while praça is not having an event . The nice view, easy to access, almost at the corner. If you like photography or you are Instagramer, here is the one! Don't miss it :) "Good for rainy days even! " Cause the streets are empty for you taking pictures.

Amazing point of view. It is an interesting place, a lift take you until the middle and after some stairs you arrive at the top . From there you dominate the Taje river, and all the ancient districts of the capital.

Shopping, Eating, Viewing beautiful architecture. This is a busy hub of a place in central Lisbon. If you look at the arch from the seaside, it is beautiful. The intricate design of the arch itself is awesome. There are trams going places and you can also easily get an Uber car. Walk in under the arch and you are in a buzz of activity, with street performers in abundance. Some are actually quite good. The shops are the usual variety--H&M, etc. I think if you want local things, you must walk outside of this center to find them. Be careful of the hawkers for the various eateries, as they will usher you in quickly. Some of the food is not very good, so I'd say to look at menus before sitting down. This wasn't my favorite thing to do in Lisbon, but it did fill up a day.
Great views of the city. Highly recommended. Inexpensive. Entrance on the left side of Rua Augusta. Elevator to top floor and then stairs to go up.

Fantastically impressive. At the far end of the busy Rua Augusta you will be drawn to walk down to see this impressive arch, one side it has a coat of arms facing the Praca do Comercio square, and the other side looking up Rua Augusta has a beautiful monument clock featuring motifs.
Look through the arch to see the River Tagus.
Fantastic views. Wonderful views from the top. Small charge but well worth it. Steps & a lift but not difficult.can look right over the city centre.

Worth a visit - wonderful viewpoint. Well worth the trip up to the top of this monument - only a couple of euros and you get lovely views over the city and the sea and particularly over the square below. A working clock linked to the bell on top of the monument may encourage you to time your visit well! There's a lift and then some steps to top.
Impressive Arch. Arch is impressive and especially the way it is integrated with the neighboring buildings.The alley next to it is full of restaurants.
Impressive arch. Wandered down the pedestrian street and this arch stands almost at the bottom giving access to a stunning square. Great photo opportunity
Nice view. You have from the top of the Arc a nice view on the place and the rest of the downtown. You can see the bridge and the statue too. Quite nice
Good View. Nice place to take pictures from Lisbon, just take a lift for 3 euros and get at the top of the roof to see an amazing view.

Great architecture and view from there. it is good to visit just 2.50 Euro for entry, there is an elevator and a few steps to climb. The view is amazing - you can see the castle in Alfama, the whole city, the river.

DO IT! Super cool and CHEAP!. We were pleasantly surprised when we discovered that you can actually climb to the top for about 3 euros (talk about a cheap attraction!). An elevator takes you more than half way where, you then have to climb a few narrow winding stairs. Once up top you get a super great view of the Plaza, the city, and the river! Not to be missed!
beautiful architecture. very impressive Triumphal Arch, loved the architecture in Praca do Comercio, great river views from here.

Wonderful view of the city. We were able to get into this for free with the Lisbon City card. The view from the top is amazing. You can see everything and it is worth it just for the views! We went up both during the day and at dusk. You can see most of the popular sites from the top.
Amazing detail!!. Although this is in a fairly busy area you can take as long as you like to admire this wonderful archway.

A beautiful square at the entrance to the city.... This area is well worth a visit while in the city- it is a hub of commerce, and there are restaurants and bars, etc. all around it. We enjoy walking, and there is always a lot of activity going on in this area, with buskers performing, and you can have a view of the River Tagus as well. Well worth a visit!

Lovely view of the whole (almost) Lisbon. Early-evening views of Comercio, Tejo, Sé, Rosio and Rua da Praca is just as wonderful as from Arc de Triomphe in Paris on the Champs-Élysées ... pulsating life in the streets, a good place for unusual photographs or only watch around and keep hands with a loved one. Lift onlyin lower floor, then up the stairs. So for wheelchairs only partially.
Seen from two sides. This is an interesting piece of architecture and can be seen from Parca Comercio and Rua Augusta for the other side/
Place to see . You need to see the arch when you go to Lisboa. Very nice arch. You can go up too but, very busy, we are in May and it is packed.
Overview of the city. On top of the arch you have a stunning view over the city of Lisbon. From the Rua Augusta to the Castle to the statue Cristo Rei. Worth paying the 2,50 euros for it.

Massive and magnificent!. The soaring arch provides the perfect entrance to the Praca Comercio. It's a pleasant stroll through the shops and cafes on Rua Augusta to reach the arch and the waterfront beyond.

Colossal arch. Bit hard to miss this. In Praca do Comercio at one end is this huge arch and the other end is the waterfront. Go through this arch and you are immediately on the trendy street of Rua Augusta with all its restaurants and street entertainers. Best reached by metro station Terreiro do Paco. Just come up out of the tube station and you are in the huge square with the huge arch at one end.

Can't avoid to see it when visiting Praca do Comercio. Impressive Arch you cross gooing from Praca do Comercio to Chiado. Street artists, shops, beatiful people all around makes this pedestrian street a charming part of Lisbon on foot.
Well worth seeing!. Spectacular piece of architecture set in an elegant sure, with arched walkways similar to the Liston in Corfu on each side.
Stunning Archin Centre of Lisbon. The is area of Lisbon is very impressive - in the centre, it is the centre piece of the area. A total most visit.

Stunning gateway to the city, with the river backdrop. Dont miss!. Plenty places to view, photo, eat and drink around this spacious area, or just sit by the river. Watch out for the drug pushers that will pester all day and night in the centre, and make a firm "NO". Avoid the Tuk tuks that swamp the city now, use the trams or your legs to walk.

The big Lisbon arch. If you collect big and imposing arches, you will want this one! Paris has its Arc, London its Marble Arch - and this is Lisbon's, complete withfine clock and grand square. Really worth seeing.

Great views of the surrounding area. This visit was not in our plans but when we paid for the history of Lisbon in the Tourist Information in the square we were offered a combined ticket for an extra euro. We took up the offer and visited the next day. Not many visitors so no queue and only a few people on the 'roof'. Lovely sunny day so it was ideal. Great views.Would recommend

Awesome views from the top! . I guess that's the main attraction... the awesome views you get from the top! :) This is not a good place for disabled people or with mobility problems, since you have to go up and down very narrow round stairs. For those who are up to it and love a great place with bird's-eye view, this is an awesome spot.

Lovely Views. We went to the top of this it has amazing views you can see all over Lisbon and out to the water and the other side. The statues are beautiful close up and you also can see the clock mechanism in side very cool. But really a great photo opportunity.
Beautiful view. Visit right before sunset. Totally worth the visit. Beautiful view and not crowded at all on a Friday evening. You take the elevator and then some steps.
The Arc of Lisbon.. The Arco Triunfal da Rus Augusta is lovely. The setting is gorgeous and the square beautiful. A very picturesque spot in Lisbon that should be on all itineraries.

Lisbon Arc. This is located within the Praca du Comercio square which has load of cafe's and restaurants on the side. Walking farther along is the harbour where the Ponte Vinte Cinco Abril bridge is in all its glory! We had a fabulous time snapping photos and loittering around Lisboa!

Photgraphic Arch. This arch separates the Praca do Commercio from the Avenue Augusta that is one of the major shopping areas of Lisbon. Although we did not do so, the top of arch can be reached by elevator to the top for a nominal fee. Great photos can be taken from there.

Centrepiece of the rebuilding of Lisbon. Commemorating the rebuilding of Lisbon after the 1755 Earthquake, this arch is the centrepiece of the plaza looking out to the sea. There is a side entrance for those who wish to climb up to the top of the monument, but it is best seen as a major piece of historic civic architecture.

Great views! . We were tempted by the elevator further down Rua Augusta, but having read that the Arch has better views, cheaper entry and potentially no queues we thought we'd give it a shot. We visited late evening and that was perfect as we hit 'golden hour' in terms of the beautiful light across the city and also zipped straight up in the lift and found the viewing platform to be nice and quiet (perfect for lots of pictures!) definitely recommended for the bargain price of €2.50!

Fantastic Arco and fantastic view. This Arc has been opened not to long ago and it is really great to see what a beautiful surprise this is, the views here are fantastic and the renovation as well . A must see and really cheap as well
Very nice view of Lisboa. We recommend this place as a must see for everyone. Very nice view of Lisboa! (free for Lisboa Card holders, about 75 steps + lift ).

Impressive and meaningful. A beautiful gateway to the plaza and sea beyond. Take he time to really examine the special beauty of this monument. It is quite breathtaking and that makes it tempting to stand there with or without the selfie stick and click and move on. Whatever you do, don't be a tourist. Be an art lover and spend some time looking at the thing and soaking up all the meaning.

Don't forget the EarthCache!!. On a sunny afternoon, I walked down the main avenue to the river, through this impressive Arch. Really worth taking quite a few pictures. And once you are there, if you like Geocaching ... you should know what to do :-)

So nice its beautiful. This is one of my favorite destination the architecture is amazing in the plaza as well the Arc that leads you to a busy street full of shops and restaurants. Grab a Pastel de Nata or try the other sweets that they offer in most of the place. Then walk all the way to the next square and on the left side you find the train station with Starbucks coffee good for resting after a long walk.
Enter history. This arch leads to the historic city center of Lisbon. Passing under it you enter the old commercial center, now converted to offices, stores and shops and squares.
An impressive view right next to the sea front. A good area to walk from as not far from the shopping and walking centre of Lisbon - just a short stroll to the sea front walk and port areas.
photo op!. Giant monument with great history. Its a quick stop right at the start of Praca do Comercio. Pass under and take some photos...

interesting piece of art. It's interesting architectural item of Lisbon city, not only due to the historic and artistic side, but also the location matching perfectly with the surroundings.
Is also a nice option to go to the top, worth to pay the ticket and have a unique view over the square and the river side.

Masterpiece. A colossal arch that connects the city center and the Praca dos Comercio. You can take the elevator for a fee and a see the wonderful view of the city. The city's arch is a centerpiece to be admired. Its a beautiful example of artistic talent and a showpiece.

Wonderful views!. We got a tip from a Portuguese friend that the public can now go up the famous white arch. Only just opened and 2.50 Euros each. Hardly anyone up there whereas the Eiffel 'tower' was heaving. Superb 360 degree views of the city.

Great view of the Praca do Commercio and Rio Tejo. This was another must visit site and was also accessible for free for holders of the Lisbon Card. The clock mechanism was being wound during our visit and it was interesting to see the link between mechanism and bell above on the belvedere. The views of the Praca do Commercio, on one side, and the Rua Augusta, on the other, are excellent and the more interesting for their intimacy and evocation of the Roman era. The sculpture on top of the arch is also very impressive. As at every other historical or site of interest in Lisbon we found the staff very friendly, helpful and very capable English speakers.

Wonderful views. Lisbon, being built on some very steep hills, is all about views, which makes walking around the city such a wonderful experience. The view from the top of the arch is very different from the rest as it's in the lower, central part of the city and provides 360 degree views.Access is through an elevator ride, followed by a climb on a narrow spiral staircase with "traffic lights" allowing for alternating up / down traffic.
A diiferent view of Lisbon. We stumbled on this place as we went in to ask about another museum. The 2 euro entrance fee is well worth paying to see the streets of Lisbon from on high.

Great views a must climb. Arch that can be seen from the main boulevard through Lisbon and a climb to the top is more than worth it.Great views onto the main square & back into Lisbon city, only 5 euros for two & there's a lift, great.
Pretty nice view on the top. It's not a must see place but it's worth of couple of euros to pay a visit. The stair to the top after the elevator are really narrow.

Majestic Arch- gateway to Lisbon's Hertage.. This imposing arch forms the northern side of the Praca commercio.There are beautiful carved figures on all sides,but the most meaningful is the triad of glory holding hands of valour and genius on the top of the arch.For a small fee you can climb the tower to have panoramic views,but very early in the morning it was closed.

Nice touch of history. This is Lisbon's "Triumph Arc".On the top are statues which represent historical figures such as Viriato, Marques de Pombal, Numo Alvares Pereira and Vasco da Gama.So when you're down in this area - the Baixa - make sure to extend your stroll all the way towards the river front at Praca do Comercio and marvel at this arch which is a supreme symbol of Lisbon's resurrection.
Beautiful place. The arch looks great both from the distance and the close-up. Worth going up as it offers beautiful views.

Better view than Santa Justa elevator. Ever since I started planning my sightseeing in Lisbon, people were telling me not to miss the view from Santa Justa elevator. Well, if you ask me, this one is even more beautiful, while the waiting is shorter. I would definitely recommend visiting.

Great to see. Similar to other monuments in the world, but it's placement by the water is what makes it so beautiful to see. All the buildings around it are yellow and marble and the square that leads to the streets is fun with little tables of local crafts. I recommend seeing it at night all lit up. Truly a sight to see

Stunning From Ground Level, Fantastic Views From The Top. The arch is beautiful, very intricate and imposing from ground level but also worth paying the small fee to get to the top. A lift whisks you most of the way up and there never seemed to be any queue. A few steps to climb to get right to the top but the views are well worth it. Superb panoramas of the square below, the city streets and the river - breath-taking. You can stay as long as you like and apart from us there were only 3 others up top.

Triumphant. It fits perfectly to the surroundings of the square, celebrating the triumph over nature. Just accidentally discovered that it can also be an excellent view point without the fuss and waiting of Santa Justa Elevator and at half the price. No disabled access.

Great architecture and good photo opportunity. Beautiful area, landscaped into a plaza where you walk around easily, can see the sea and it leads to/from a main thoroughfare of shops/restaurants/places of interest.Trams/buses can be taken from here and a Metro station is nearby.Allow 20 minutes to look around and you'll be done.
Beautiful architecture. Second Triunfal is magnificent at head of classic wide European major shopping & strolling street. Great ice cream shops.

Amazing views & history. Gorgeous Arch with really cool sculptures on top. I took a lift up to the very top (only €2.50) and I was to say the view was incredible. You can see different parts of the city from the top: over looking the beach, Alfama, etc.The lift takes you quite high up and then you have to walk up a few steps no big deal ... But it is definitely worth it and I highly recommend it.Under the arch there is beautiful walkways where people sell all kinds of ornate products on stalls.
Lovely arch. You can't miss the arch if you're in Old City Lisbon. It is amazing and seems like the history is all the way around. Definitely worthwhile to explore.

Looking triumphant. Try not to race under the arch on your way to the waterfront or commercial section. The arch looks pristine, and great and you can marvel at the carvings. ALso you can enjoy the covered walkways on either side. Such a beautiful landmark in a beautiful city, and you can have a rest at the nearby open air cafes/restaurants to truly appreciate the wonderful arch. Great scenic setting.
Great views, no queues. We spent €2.50 to go to the top instead of waiting in a very long queue for the Elevator. Amazing views of the Praca do Commercio.

The story of an arch born of an earthquake.. In 1755, Lisbon suffered an earthquake who caused a Tsunami.Lisbon was devastated, the King fled to a tent and stood still terrified.Then, a man, a providential man, the Marquis of Pombal, both a dictator and a powerful organizer, rolled up his sleeves and got to work.He chose a wonderful team of architects, city planners and engineers and rebuilt, in few years, a new Lisbon.In the new main square - Terreiro do Paço - he built a 30m high arch symbolizing the triumph of the will and he didn't forget to carve his own statue...You can go by lift to the top and enjoy one of the most wonderful views of the capital, both towards the River Tagus and, opposite, towards Rua do Ouro.

Majestic Arch. Don't just rush under the arch on your way to the waterfront or commercial section. Savour the details. Marvel at the carvings. Stroll along the covered walkways on either side. Such a beautiful landmark in a beautiful city.
Imposing. It's certainly imposing. A great centrepiece to the main square opposite the waterfront, and a nice walk through to the main shopping area.I guess you'd call it a bit of a feature!
Monumental. Wow that must have taken some time to carve. Quite a landmark and great backdrop to the Square! Nice covered area for sheltering from the rain plus watching trams and tuktuks and people!
A triumph.. A very beautiful arch of triumph, built after the earthquake, stands beautifully as an entry into the biggest square in Lisbon. Lovely architecture, definitely worth passing.
Beautiful arch. The rua Augusta features great shopping and will bring you to Avenida de Libertade.A must visit, again, wear comfy shoes.
Ok for a triumphal Arch. An arch is an arch - it's big, everyone takes a photo, the street leading up to it is interesting, the square after walking through it is large, what more can be said!
Great views. Lift half way up then 72 steps. Fantastic views from the top over the bay and old town. Well worth the few euros.
It is nice to see but not a must see. As with most of the places that I visited in Lisbon it was not awe-inspiring but it was something to see.
Magnificient. Magnificient entrance to the Capital with enormous statues-really impressive at the enormous square Parca do comercio- pæne of the biggest squares in Europe

A brief trip to the top. we had an hour to spare before heading off, we managed to get to the top and it was totally worth it, what a great view of this fabulous city. We were so lucky to be there when the clock chimned, great to be able to see the workings of the clock.

Large portal opening up to the sea.. Walking along this street, through the imposing gate, and suddenly the sea is there. An enormous space with fresh sea air. Built after the devastating earthquake in 1755. It is more tna 30 meters high. It is a monument with scultptures, the most important on the top is a large female figure holding to crowns. On the sides there are represented Vasco da Gama, the explorer, and Marquis de Pombal, the rebuilder of the city after the catastrophy among others.
Beautiful architecture. Arco da Rua Augusta beautifully connects Rua Augusta and Praca do Comercio. Good photo opportunities!
Great view from the top. This is a lovely building which looks so impressive from the square. You can pay 2.50 euros to go to the top (under 5's free). Its worth it for the fantastic view
Stunning arch. At the base of the city after you walk all the way from up north near the airport. The square that faces the arch is enormous and has a maze of things to see. Great people watching.

Brilliant. I am not exactly into architecture but even I was impressed by this huge and magnificent archway. It ornate and includes a clock too. The vista from the arch across the square is great, as it the view in towards the town linking it to another square more central to the theatre etc.

Very nice view - Rua Augusta- Arch and Belvedere Lisbon downtown. From the top you have a fantastic view through the square (Praça do Comércio) and the river. In it´s interior you can see the clock room with a mechanical clock.You can visit it everyday till 19h00 I think. Price is 2,50; kids up to 5 are free.
Narrow winding steps to get up, but good views.. Tight winding steps to reach the top after the lift access. Worth a visit at sunset, only 2.5€. Great views over the river front.
A view over the river. It is a wonderful view from the top, You can see the other margin of Lisbon, and in a clear day you can see forever. The statues around you are very interesting.
Interesting place. Definitely worth it to see. A lift to the top and admire the panorama of the city. That's all. Generally Lisbon is too overrated.
Not a must but interresting.. In case you are at Praca do Comércio and have some spare time then go to the Top of this arch and have a good 360° view of Lisbon's downtown.

Great attraction to visit. Nothing too exciting about this place, as with all others arcs of Europe.
For 1.45 errors you can go up with a lift and discover the city from the above.
Look at how beautiful this archway is!. And you must look up from both sides and see the clock. The architecture is amazing and the scale is immense. You just need to take it in.

View. you go up in a lift most of the way, then up some narrow stair ways to the top entry is 2-50 which is good value when you get to the top the view is WOW would deffo say go up we came down just before sunset, but given another chance would stay up there for it has it must be amazing.
Promenade. Entrance to pedestrian plaza with monuments, street performers and leading to picturesque view on the waterfront. There is also a Beer Museum located nearby!
nice symbol. A nice symbol, located central at the end (or beginning) of the shopping avenue. A great view to see.
Short trip. Up and down again. Great view and ok site.Not to expencive either. Not to crowded either, maybe because a rainy day.Been there done that
Perfect way to end (or start) your time in Lisbon. Wonderful views, and may I congratulate this venue on being non-smoking, it's fantastic to see an attraction that values the health of their guests.

Triumphant views over city and river. The modest entry fee gives you access to a lift that takes you up most of the way. Steps then take you up the next couple of levels with a very simple exhibition at the first level after exiting the lift.Worth it both for the up close views of the huge statues (toes/wings and claws all could be observed in detail) and the wonderful views of the city below and beyond.

Worth a visit.. This is at the end of one of the main routes to the coast. It is worth a visit. The only thing that lets this down is that its hard to look at it for too long without someone coming up to you and trying to sell you something, over and over again.

Great architecture. The best part of this attraction is that you are not required to travel exclusively for seeing this. If you are visiting Praca de Comercio you will find the Arch at the end of the street. Walk through and you will enter into a great market.

Gateway to the Tagus!. Beautiful landmark with a stunning click and yes yoy can go up and admire the view of the river and city! It's a great place to stroll and see the vendors under the arches and to walk along the riverfront. An all time favorite place to take friends!

Lisbon's newest attraction. Probably one of the greatest values in Lisbon, for about 2.50 euro, you accent to the top of the arch and have unique views of Lisbon downtown and the St. George Castle. Beautiful sunset and the perfect spot to end a day tour of Lisbon. A bit hidden to find, but ask around and you'll find the little entrance at the end of Rua Augusta.

It's all Praca do Comercio. I love lisbon. The architecture and atmosphere are beautiful but if you look at the list of top things to do, four or five of the top ten are all areas next to each other in the city center. This is a nice arch I guess but it's in the middle of Praca do comercio so don't plan too much extra time here. I did however like the view from the seafront accross the road of the bridge and southern part of the city.

Great views. If you like going up tall things and having views across a city then this is for you. We were lucky to have the top of the building to ourselves so it was very peaceful. A lift takes you part way up and then a narrow spiral staircase leads to the roof. Not much to see on the way up but the views of Lisbon and the castle are well worth the small entrance fee.

A short stop by the Commerce Plaza. Although the architecture is one of the topics to admire in this place, the surroundings are even better, the buildings around the plaza are unique as well the sculptures and themes
Best view of city. Loved this view/ few people waiting- short q/ good price and lots of space at the top. Not great for people with poor knees as its a narrow staircase.
Nice landscapes. OK, this is paid attraction, but if you want to see something nice - you need to pay.There are scenic views from the top of the arc.
Impressive views from behind into the square. Lovely photo op. From either side to get a view through the archway. Better in good light. Early morning has less crowds to get in the picture.

Enjoyable to walk to! . The walk to get here is nice. You walk by many shops and restaurants along a pedestrian only street. The area does have its share of solicitors and pickpockets, as does any large city. When you continue on you arrive at the river.
ARCO DA RUA AUGUSTA. I walked from the Hotel down to the Arco Rua Augusta, and I love it, the weather in Lisbon is great , people are very friendly

History speaks to us. From the Arco triunfal da Rua Augusta we can see the river, the sea, the other side of the river and Jesus statue, as we can see the wonderful portuguese calçadas and hand made tiles, you can't go to Lisbon and not visit this place.
Amazing. Fabulous view at the end of the street towards the sea, a real stand out on the front at Lisbon. Well worth going.

Climb to the top!. Few people know this (for now) but you can climb to the top! theres an elevator access at the bottom of the arch to take you most of the way up. Then some stairs but nothing too serious. And it is so worth it. The views over the Rua Augusta and over large parts of the city are AMAZING! You really should not miss this. Worth the fee to get up there and then some!

Great. This at the end of the square as you come to the river a huge arch which is very impressive well worth the walk as go under it on the way to the river,a lovely area to have a stroll, and watch the world go by
Masterpiece. Colosal triumph arch that connects the city centre and the Praça do Comercio, the huge open square to the Tejo river.

Drug dealers, prostitutes and tourists. Rua Augusta is a historic pathway in the middle of Lisbon. Still, it is not exactly the most pleasant place nowadays: you'll be overwhelmed by sketchy offers, day and night.
Great Location. Located right in the city centre, at one end of the main street. You can pay to go up for the views.

The gate to the Tagus!. Once you cross this arco you will be in the Praça do Comercio and... Just in front of the magnificence of the river and the wonderful view of the Christ statue and the XV Abril bridge! The style of the gate is really elaborated and offer many picture opportunities from different angles. I had no time to take the opportunity of enjoying the view from above from the mirador located there... Well... We will do it next time!!
Big Arch. We got to see this huge arch upon walking the shopping grounds of Lisboa. There are also couple of restaurants amd cozy cafe along the way. Nice

Spectacular Arc at the start of Rua Augsta. Reminiscent of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, this stately monument opens on to Rua Augusta. It is a great piece of architecture and the street that follows makes for an enjoyable stroll.

Great!. We went here in januari and it wasnt very cold. The sun was shining pretty bright and there was a light breeze. The detail on the arch was pretty amazing and there was a nice view on the ocean and the south bank.
Must see. Ok so I do have a passion for building and monuments. But you really do have to see this arch it is truly amazing the way it frames the street statue and view to the river.

Can't miss it. Made of stone, it looks like what it is, a triumphal arch-like, historical building located on Commerce Square. There was an earthquake in 1755 and this was built to commemorate the city's reconstruction. You can see the Portuguese coat of arms and the sculpture of Glory rewarding valour and genius by French sculptor Célestin Anatole Camels.

stunning monument. we walked there on a cloudy day. The monument it self represent what a tourist expect to see from a great city like Lisbon. My only regret was the weather. Chose a sunny day if you want to explore the area better.

Amazing visit. We visited Lisbon for the day, taking the bus up from Vilamoura... (3.5/4 hour drive) but we'll worth it!We walked from the bus station to the Arco Triunful square to experience some of city it took a good 45 to an hour...mainly because we didn't know where we were going and often wandered towards things that looked interesting.But there is so much to see, so I would love to visit again, there's a host of ways to see it all as well... tram, tour bus, segway (if you brave), metro (if you want to go it alone), or on foot...(if your a real wanderer)! You definately see more of the city life on foot.The lead up to the Arco was buzzing with energy, shoppers, performers, music and tourists... lots of cafes, restaurants and plenty of shopping.Castles, historical tours, museums, the zoo and plenty more.Amazing times to be had, loved it!
Gem.. Beautiful ceiling, romantic setting with the view of the river or pedestrian Rua Augusta.Some good shops nearby.Very often windy because of proximity of the water.

Some of the Best Views of the City. Some of the best views of the city are from the top of the arch. Traffic up and down the stairs is controlled by a colored light system so no need to worry about squeezing by passing visitors.

Stunning view over downtown Lisbon and Tagus river. Near Comércio Square, downtown, it's possible to overlook Lisbon from the triumphal arch rooftop of Augusta street.A lift will take you up. Open from 9AM to 7PM.A short visit of 30 minutes is enough to enjoy the 360º stunning views. Bring all the family members, take amazing pictures having the city as scenario, and don't forget to ring the bell!

Beautiful scenery over Praça do Comércio and Tagus River. If you wish to overlook Praça do Comércio from the heights and have a look over the architecture of 'Lisbon Baixa' streets, than you must take the lift to miradouro do Arco da Rua Augusta.You can buy the combined ticket for Lisbon Story Centre, since it also deserves a visit and learn more about Lisbon history.
nice place. a bit of a bottle neck on silvester after the fireworks :)luckily i am not claustrophobic.Nice arcitecture and surroundings.
connects square commercial to shopping street. connects square commercial to shopping street. nice arch with nice details. take a nice picture from the square commercial

Great view of sea, castelo and Rua Augusta. No line to enter, this attraction is a wonderful spot to view the Castelo do Sao Jorge on the hill, the pedestrian Rua Augusta with its inlaid stonework, and the harbor sea.

Great view of the city's downtown and old harbour. For just €2,50 you can go to the top and have a great view of the downtown as well as of the Commerce Square, tha Castle of Saint George and of the old harbour leading to Tejo River. It's date goes back from 1875 and it's the main entrance of the city, meaning the triumph of Lisbon. Worth to see.

Beautiful arc marking the entrance to Rua Augusta!. There's no way you'll miss it since its location is pretty central and it's a great place for photographs! Its history is also very interesting so if you have a way of finding it out, make sure to do so!

Magnificent architectural example. A city's arch is always a centerpiece to be admired. This arch is a beautiful example of artistic talent and the showpiece the king had in mind when he commissioned it. It's the entrance to the plaza of commerce and the water's edge. Free for the looking. It seems like it's perpetually very busy and crowded on the square. Be mindful of your valuables.

Attractive arch in the Chiado district. This arch looks out over the Praca do Comercio and up Rua Augusta and the shopping district. It's a beautiful old structure and has been well maintained (after probably some extensive restoration work). Very photogenic if you can get the sun at the right angle.
Beautiful Arch. This arch leads into the city or out towards the main plaza. An architectural wonder of Lisbon. No doubt it won't be missed.
A grat view to the lisbon dontown. From the top of this arch you can see a great view to the downtown Lisbon!! A visit for all the family!

a must see location. This is where you should start your first day! looking into the city from the waterfront and getting your bearings - wonderful square where you can sit and enjoy people watching and the view of the ocean.

Historical Architecture. It's a beautiful bit of architecture. What a gorgeous landmark. This once was the grand entrance to the city. Lift to the top,just 2.5 euros, so no need to worry about having to climb hundreds of stairs. The view is well worth it.
Imposing! . Wow, a great piece of historical architecture with massive public square and the entrance to the main pedestrian shopping area; so fabulous in the evening when all lit for Christmas.
Imposing . This arch dominates the square that leads to the promenade by the sea. To cross the road to the Arc there is the longest 'Zebra crossing' I've ever seen.
Quite impressive . A very interesting piece of architecture dominating the square, also visible from the street cafes on the road leading to it.
Can't not finding it. The Arco is a great monument just in front of the Praça do Comércio. There is no way not seeing it! Take your time to enjoy every single detail!
Amazing experience. First time there and I loved it. Amazing view from the top you call see all the down town from there and take amazing pictures. The price is worth (only 2.5€ per person)
Good views. It was well worth me visiting the monument and going to the top for the views. I also enjoyed seeing the sunset from the top.

Saw the monument! . During our Lisbon tour we saw this monument which is very close to the sea and the main town area.
Very touristy and lots of cafe around.
Arco Triunfal . I started walking around from our hotel and found this beautiful piece of architecture. Definitely worth visiting and learning the history about.
Quite the entrance. Very impressve entrance to the pedestrian district. The architecture is very intricate and impressive. Worth a stop by.
What an entrance to the main pedestrian precinct. Over looks the main square and the river plus you can go uptop to admire the view in both directions.

Lisbons most impressiv Rooftop. Its one of Lisbon Citys beacons . Well known . The " Arch " is the " historical main portal " to pass if you are " walking intoo Lisbon " . Long years , closed to the public , opend and cleaned , you can take a lift " to Lisbons most impressiv Rooftop " . The Single adult Ticket was in October / 2015 - 2,50 Euros . Unfortunatly , the structure doesnt allows a acess for all those visitors who cant climb stairs / wheelchair . So , if you wanna visit this attraction please remind , you need still climb stairs and you shouldnt be high afraid . For everybody else , i recommend a visit . Specially if you want take some nice Pictures of a Sun Set .
Beautiful white arch.. It's a beautiful bit of architecture. For a small amount of money you can go to the top and watch a beautiful sunset.

Majestic in size, quality of workmanship and focal point in the surroundings. We could see the top of the Arch from the ruins of Carmo, we saw parts of it as we walked throughout Lisbon. Finally we got to it as we walked the waterfront. What a gorgeous landmark! An easy "if we get separated" check in spot it is spectacular. The huge open square across the street and track lines with Jose 1st statue and the great stairs down to the waterfront is people watching at its best. Young lovers, old lovers, children running to the water and back like a flock of tiny birds, down and back, down and back. The arch itself has such dynamic carvings and detailed illustrations I stood on the "inside" looking out toward the bay, then from the bay side looking inward to the vibrant shopping area. It's a lovely snap shot of life in Lisbon at any time of any day.
A grand entrance-way. This once was the grand entrance to the city and is unmissable. It makes for great photographs with plenty to see and do in the vicinity.

Beautiful. At the begining of a walking tour which began at the Palace Square (Comercio Square) we marveled at this triumphal arch which lead us to the pedestrian street lined with every kind of shop imanginable.

Maybe 'just an arch / archway' but truly is an impressive central point, strong architectural backdrop, etc.!!!. The Arch of Augusta Street may be just a decorative arch / archway to some, but for many whether tourist or local longtime resident, the arch IS (next to or viewed behind the the equestrian statue of King Jose 1 in the centre of the massive waterfront public square that the arch way opens up onto) an amazing backdrop to the public square, an VERY IMPRESSIVE architectural element full of symbolism, an easy to find central meeting point is your group gets separated for any reason, AND also announces the entrance to either the amazing waterfront / riverfront open, historic plaza if you approach it from the north , OR opens onto introduces the foor of the amazing Augusta Street pedestrian open air shopping mall with it's amazing collection (wide mix) of retail shops - high end and tourist - and great cafes and restaurants.The arch is self is an extremely beautiful, picturesque, and symbolic classical style sculpture which acts as the central point of the historic architecture of buildings that surround the 3 sides of the amazing, wide open public plaza / water front square.The archway also acts as a central point of pick-up or drop-off for various means of public transportation - buses, trams, taxis / cabs, tuc tucs, segway tour groups, and even a meeting point for large group of travellers that arrive at the waterfront via the massive international cruise ships that dock nearby.(Google the arch to find out more important specific details of it's history and the symbolism of the various sculptures incorporated into it's design.Also on Saturdays and Sundays, the arch provides the focal point for an outdoor marketplace of better quality, genuine had crafted artists, craft makers, jewellry makes, etc. We actually stayed just a block away from the archway and public square, and visited the market several times over the weekend.All in all, the archway IS one of the main visual icons that represent and is photographed thousands of times a day for the central public square.Don't be turned off by the possible throngs of tourists. Take time to view and enjoy the artwork of the arch, and take in the ambiance of this central and historically important old world core of Lisbon. We went to and through the arch at all times of the day - and it always made for GREAT photographs and an amazing backdrop for family memories.Not to be missed!
Cool neighbourhood. The arc itself is just there, more impressive though than cool. The neighbourhood has got some nice restaurants and brothels though, which make this the place to be.

Great views from the top. We payed E2.50 to take the lift to the top. There is an interesting display about the history of the area half way up, and you can see the clock mechanism. Then at the top it's a great view of Lisbon in all directions, and fun to see the sculptures close up too. The stairs are steep and winding so not for the very unfit or those who suffer with vertigo.

Excellent perspective on the city.. Lift to the top (just 2.5 euros), so no need to worry about having to climb hundreds of stairs. The view is well worth it, so would help you to get oriented if you did it early in your trip to Lisbon.

Big and clean. If you're a fan of arches you'll like this one. You can't miss it as it's really big and it's between the main pedestrianised shopping street and the waterfront. Only 2.50 Euro to go up it and the entrance is on the left going towards the sea. In a rather down-at-heel city with lots of dirty, poorly maintained buildings, this monument at least is sparkling clean. Not something requiring a special trip but worth including if you're wandering around the Biaxa area.

Very impressive Arch. Situated at the end of Rua Augusta this is magnificent Arch that leads to the Square and eventually the riverside. just great to stroll around admire the whole are and its architecture. Well worth a visit.
You Can't Miss It. Dominating the end of Rua Augusta, Lisbon's pedestrian shopping street the Arch is fun as you can go up in it, something easy to miss as the entrance isn't well marked.

Impressive Arch. . Situated between the main Rua Augusta walking street and the Placa do Commercio, it is a most impressive monument. White in colour with interesting and skilful carvings. You can't miss it if you're walking round the old town.

Great view. It's a program that everyone must do. We've got a fantastic view of Lisbon for only 2,5€. And preferably in the late afternoon to obtain the best feeling of Lisbon' light and the crowd return to home after work
Pretty cool. Nice arch, lots of detailed carvings and stuff. Leads out to a big square in front of the sea. Worth a visit.
Huge arc. Between la Praca do Commercio and Rua Augusta this huge " door " connect one of the Street of Lisbon to the river
free view as part of your walking tour. no reason to go up, a fun area with bustle of mostly tourists. Walk thru, check out the river, find a café for food and drink...

A "must see" for the easily impressed. A large triumphal arch similar to triumphal arches in many cities. Originally intended to commemorate the 1755 earthquake, but not finished until 1875; thus providing it's own comment on Portuguese progress. One side faces the Praca do Comercio where pickpockets and drug dealers frolic unimpeded among tourists. The other side faces the Rua Agusta, a wide shopping mall filled with the usual multinational shops, "Oh dear, we found the cutest little H & M in Lisbon, don't you know."

good part of the city. This is a nice part of the city,there are lots of places to eat and many shops. There is a very big plaza just a few meters away which is amazing. This is a good place to send some of the day. Remember the Portuguese make there own boots and shoes of leather and they very good quality. Also very reasonable price.
Impressive. Highlights the plaza. Many shops, restaurants and museums in the area. Lots of activity. Great views of the river.

Iconic archway at end of Rua Augusta. This is part of the Praca do Comercio square and forms the end of the Rua Augusta - main pedestrianized way from Rossio down to the river. Apparently, good to go up at sunset, although we didn't manage that.
to the top. Go to the top and you'll have a beautiful view from our amazing city of Lisbon,not expensive at all.
The best view in Baixa. I was there three times since it open again, it's one of my favorite places of Baixa. The view that you get from there is so beautiful, that you want to take 360º photos!

Over Arching. Get the lift 2.50 Euros most of the way to the top then a few flights of stairs to the roof terrace. Great 360 degree views over Lisbon and the river, from Praca do Comercio up R. Augusta to Praca Dom Pedro IV.
OK.... If you are in this area, then you can't really miss it, but it is nothing special. This area is the toursit hot-sot, so be prepared...
Central square within lisbon. Huge square near the front some restaurants around and also close by.Marvellous architecture all around the square and lots of people watching.
The perfect place to feel the city energy.. If you have time you must seat in one of the terraces around the square, enjoy a good portuguese cofee and enjoy the view, worth it.
Historical place. Nice to visit such historical places and nice for taking photos as well. Quality restaurants and bars are around
Magnifico monumento na baixa de Lisboa, estratégicamente localizado.. Beautiful and very well located in downtown, near the river. You can see it when you are visiting the historic center of Lisbon.
views over Lisbon. Only 2.50 EUR to take the lift up to an enclosed viewing room, a small spiral staircase takes you to the top with great views over central lisbon and the river.
Not to be missed!. For a very modest fee you ascend first to the clock room and then to the open top of the Arch. Superb views over the city. This little trip is a must!

Beautiful & Impressive. Beautiful arch gate that is located on the entrance of Comercio Square when you reach it through the walking street called Rua Augusta. This site is a must visit for tourists in Lisbon. The best way to see this is by enjoying walking from Rossio metro station through Rua Augusta walking street.
Beautiful. This is a very photogenic Arch near the sea front. It is difficult to miss if you are in Lisbon as a tourist.
Definitely worth a visit . Beautiful and right by the sea. Great history too. Huge plaza surrounded by a few cafes. Really nice area which you can reach by bus, taxi, tuk tuk or tram

impressive and a must. nice monument with beautiful architectural structures, a walk through history marks your shoulders as you walk under it, so many kings, tyrants, martyrs, soldiers have walked there...

Visually Stunning Entryway to the Commercial Plaza and the riverfront.. At the end of Rua Augusta, restaurant row and pedestrian zone, this arch makes an impressive framing of the plaza beyond and the river views. It's possible to climb to the top, fee charged, but we didn't take the time. Too hot a day.

Easy to climb and a wonderful view. It is a wonderful building worth to see in details. But it is great to climb on the top, too. There is an elevator that you have to pay. I forgot but I think the elevator was just to second or third floor and then there are stairs to the top. I try to climb to the highest buildings in all cities that I visit because the view is really great but some stairs are really scary. The stairs here were very easy to climb and there were even small children climbing. The view is really great so it is worth to go to the top.
Impressive arch. It is now possible to go up to the top for a small charge where there is a great 360 degree view of Lisbon.

Beautiful structure. A focal point on downtown Lisbon, this is a beautiful structure that you cannot miss on a visit to Lisbon. Set at the entrance to the main square down on the water, it is constantly surrounded by tourists, but we'll worth a look.

Impressive!. A wonderful sight. Start your walk from Rossio square and walk down Rua Augusta under the very impressive arch and finish up in the wonderful Praca do Comercio, before heading down to the Cais das Colunas. A lovely way to take in the main and best sights of Chiado.
Arco Triunfal just up the street!. Beautiful arc just up the pedestrian street of Rua Augusta which is also where we stayed. Impressive mo u ent overlooking the river. A must see!

Majestic work of architecture. This Tiumphal Arch stands at the End of Rua Augusta leading to the Praca do Comercio. The details of the moldings under the Arch are very beautiful, worthy of some photos.Altogether a very impressive Arch.

Impressive. Beautiful and impressive triumphal arch. It is possible to go to the top to see amazing views of Lisbon. We didn't do that on this occasion, but enjoyed it from the ground instead. Great photo opportunity.
