Majestic entry to the Rua Augusta. Nice example of triumphal arc with great attention to details, contributing a lot for the gorgeous layout of Rua Augusta and the Royal part of Lisbon
Entrance to the promenade . Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta is at the entrance to Praco da Comercia and to the river's promenade. Lovely atmosphere!!!

Overlooking history...tells its own story. This is another beautiful landmark which overlooks a grand square, and bears the story of the city's history....in addition to the grand arch itself, there are many statues of important people in the city's history. Take a close look at the entire edifice and get to know the stories it tells... We were fascinated to know that we were standing on the sight of the massive 755 tsunami. The square is a great place to visit, and the arch is a wonderful monument that overlooks the many tourists and locals who pass by...
Lisbon Icon. The landmark arch is very detailed and really picturesque. The adjoining square contains a few beautiful statues as well. Nice place.

Beautiful details. The whole arch is detailed and its perfection, its located right before you enter the square, there are lots of shops before and on the beautiful day you can get some great photos, it was raining a lot when I was there but that didn’t stopped me to enjoy the moment.
Amazing views . This place has some of the most amazing views over the rooftops of Lisbon. The clock mechanism can also still be seen in full working order.

Magnifecent, do not miss this landamark. Like the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, this one is in Lisbon, and it is the same name, just in Portuguese. The details of it are fantastic, and it leads to the Rua Augusta, on one side which is full of restaurants, pastry shops, people, entreteiners, and fun, a lots of fun. On the other side, The Praca de Comercio, and the River Tagus.
Lovely arch and a good landmark. It's a beautiful arch. Went at night so didn't climb to the top, but there was a group of musicians and many people dancing, so also a good place to people watch.
Must do in Lisbon. Great walk at sunset in front of Plaza del Comercio to see a nice view of the bridge and the Christ. Many restaurants in the area, and stores.

Rare case, where it make sense to pay for a view in Lisbon. The arch could be visited. The view from the arch top offers an unbelievable view on the entire city and almost every major tourist attraction is visible from here.

Great views in central Lisbon. Pay 2.50 Euros and head up to the top of the Arc and the views are spectacular. From all angles you can see the beauty of the city from a birdseye view. Take an elevator and then two sets of circular stairs and you are there. A sunny day will help.
Good visit. Super view from up here only a few minutes walk from city centre to this right down by the water front and only a few Euros to go up
Emblematic Monument. Emblematic monument in the city, it marks the centre of the city and you can't miss it. Great photo opportunity and adds a feel of grandeur to an already beautiful plaza.
Wonderful . A beautiful view, for sure. You can see all the city and it's totally worth it. It's not available for wheelchairs.
BeautifuL arc. Very impressive arc at the end of the street, taking one into the largest square of Lisbon. Carved stone details

Amazing !. Have to go there. Plenty of places to enjoy different kinds of food. Many artist displaying their many talents. Lots to see and buy! The Arch itself is beautiful. A lot of detail went into this,and so high too! A lot of walking but lots to do and see.Beautiful at night all lit up!

Copy of the Triumph Arc of Paris. Beautiful arc and that's it. Has a significant sign in the Portugal's history. Not a must to see. Has more significance fir Portuguese people than tourists all over the world.
Amazing views!. We had walked under this arch many times. We found that you can pay to go up in an elevator and then take stairs the the top of the arch for amazing views of the city and for sunsets!

Great structure, interpretation isn't great. The view is absolutely amazing and of course the structure in itself is built heritage and therefore excelent. It is also inexpensive to visit but the interpretation leaves a lot to be desired. The display panels are challenging to read as they are white letters on a white background and you have to position yourself at an angle people can see. I doubt it very much that anyone with a visual impairment is able to access it. It is hard to understand how the clock mechanism works and it would be worth explaining to those who are not portuguese (I am) , the significance of the people featured in the sculptures in the arch.
Great Views from The R. Take a trip to the top for just 2.50 euro and see the spectacular views - don't forget your camera. A very clever stop go system in use for the narrow stairs.

What a surprise. Located at the end of Rua Augusta, just entering Terreiro do Paço, probably the most important square in Lisbon, just by €2.5 you can have a nice experience climbing to the top of this monument and see a different view over Lisbon. Good option for the always crowded Elevador de Santa Justa

Impressive. Very photogenic, whether you are there by day or at night. Near the river with a lot of cafes around and a street market on Sunday with many craftsmen, rather craftwomen who sell a lot of nice jewellery. Don´t miss the market.
Beautiful Plaza. Quick and easy to get to from the city centre, have a quick stroll around in this beautiful square and gaze over the bay. Perhaps even a cheeky visit to the Beer Museum!

Nice to see from far. Nice to see from far, its beautiful but the place is full of pickpockets and drug dealers, its not safe to walk around in a carefree way at all, so do you need to go for a nice walk and be worried all the time, No, so don´t go there its not worth it.
Just nice view to the sea. Poor in comparison with other triomph arcs from european cities, full of "artisanal" stands with cheap products.

Boring, boring, boring. We decided to take a ticket that included Lisbon Story Centre and Rua Augusta Arch. On the way up there isn't that much to see at all and once you get up you'll be bored after literally 2 min. You can barely take photos of Praça do Comércio because of the walls and if you try and point your camera in other directions all you'll see are lots and lots of once beautiful buildings of downtown Lisbon that are now in horrible state.Definitely not worth a visit!
Impressive. Impressive monument located at the city’s main square. Definitely worth a visit and although we did not travel to the top I can imagine it offers some great views of the city.
monumental. Must visit in Lisbon. At the end of Esplanade, beautiful arc, view from the top is super nice. Beautiful place.
worth a visit :-). Nice place with a great view if you go up. It worth a visit if you are around here! The statue and the arch are really nice
On Top :). It was my first time here. You must to see Lisbon from here! :) New perspective of the city, nice spot to take some pics. Workers were nice too. :)
Excellent, especially if there is something on. Went here for a light show in Aug. Fantastic.10 out of 10 for production. crowded but a good place to grab a coffee and relax.
Restored. Finally restored Trinufal Arc, the details are very interesting and you can even go up to the top. There is a small entrance where you pay to go up.

People are like ants. Great overview from the top of the entire city. Entrance is cheap! The view, fantastic! You can look over the city and the coast like. Also the 25 de Abril bridge is visible, with the Jesus statue. The castle too. In the evening, the sunset is beautiful even though sun sets behind the buildings.
sigo seeing. You must go upstairs for sight seeing. great view!!! a must see for lisbon travellers. dont miss it!!
Beautiful view. The view is wonderful!! I loved the Comercial Square and the Tejo river there!! In my oppinion, one of the most beautiful views I have ever seen.

Popular tourist area. This is amongst the top attractions in Lisbon. Lots of history behind the construction of this triumphal arch. Popular tourist area and all restaurants and bars charge quite steep rates for food & drink
Great views. Great views for the rivers and an amazing place for taking good photos. The statue and the arch are amazing.
Great views!. Beautiful area with great river views! A lot of bars and shops and things to see! Great for taking photos! Be careful at night for people pushing drugs....

One of the best views of the city!. Situated in the beginning of Rua Augusta is one of the best places to see Lisbon from above! Panoramic view from all sides of the city help you capture the beauty of the city!
A little bit difficult to climb the narrow stairs to the top!
A real must with a reasonable price!

bang in the centre don't miss this little gem. small fee to enter and a few steps, but bang in the centre and a great view from the top . the door is tucked away for the entrance and like quite a few things in Lisbon, you do have to look to find it..lol

Impressive Arch. When in Lisbon and you see this arch all you need to do is admire the workmanship that has gone into it.
@instabuilt

Do It.... Cheap and easy to reach, the Arch itself its something nice to admire and to climb. For just a small price (around 2 euros) you can enjoy a great view of the centric part of the city and take great pictures. Most of the times, there is hardly anyone around so if you are in the area you don't have any excuses to go up for a minute or so....
Excellent view over Lisbon. Recently opened to public on of the most iconic sites in Lisbon with a splendid view of Tejo River and Terreiro do Paço.

Spent the day in Lisbon. Was a lovely sight to taking some stunning photos of the arch and the statue. The surrounding streets also have plenty of life in them with something interesting around every corner.

Another great view of the city. Just by the end of Rua Augusta which is a street with plenty of shops and esplanades it has three great features:1- The arch it self it's very beautiful.2- After you pass it by coming from Rua Augusta you'll be dazzled with 'Praça do Comércio' square.3- About an year ago you can go to the top of it and enjoy 360 views of the city (you have no better view of the castle than from here)
Augusta Triumph Arch. Nice arch in the Praça do Comércio at the end of the Augusta street, Lisbon downtown, the main place to take the tram (eléctricos), tuk-tuk car, etc.

Pay for the entrence because if not you will miss the best spot to take pictures from. Entry was 2.5, an elevator takes you up and you also have to take the stairs. You can see the castle, santa justa elevator, tram 28, the tejo river and many more.

Nice view over Lisbon. In the Praca de Comercio we found the Arch of Augusta Street.Very strategic place to built the Arch, considering the fact that in the Praca de Comercio was situated the royal palace, destroied by the great earthquake.You can climb up on the top of the Arch and can admire the view.A few statues are sorrounding the uper side of the Arch, giving it more than a door look.Opposite the Arch is one side the river Tejo and the other side place Rossio.A clock included in the Arch shows you the passing time- you can do the magic and continue your trip- but must see this Arch!
Starting Point. Every time one visits Lisbon you feel you haven't arrived until you walk through the Arch onto the Rua Augusta and into the bustle of the city.

A great area to visit and central gathering place. . This area is right in the heart of everything. The arch itself is very nice, but the plaza and surrounding area complete the picture. Good place to have a coffee or hire a Tuk Tuk driver for a tour
gate to the fancy Lisbon. The landmark in Lisbon. It ends the pedestrian commercial promenade and frames the square by the river. Many activities take place there all the time.
Great view over Lisbon and Rio Tejo without any queuing. For just 2€ and without any waiting you get access to a great view point with an amazing view over Lisbon and the river.

amazing. Loved looking at the Arch. The view through the Arch walking towards the Tagus river is amazing. Go down early in the morning to view it when their is no people around. it makes fr great photo's. Its one of the focal points of Lisbon. many bars and restaurants surround this area
Amazing view. A quick trip to have a great view of the praca de commercial square and back into the main part of the town.

Beautiful rooftop view of Lisbon. the access to the top of the Arch has only reopened recently and for 2.50Euros you get a beautiful view of the Lisbon rooftops. You can see the pedestrianized street below you, the Rua Augusta, and admire its cobbles.You can see the magnificence of the buildings that surround the square. There is a spiral staircase that leads up to the top which then leads to the rooftop terrace. the staircase is only really wide enough for one person, hence the need to press the button on what looks like a traffic light system on either side to make sure that it is clear to go up or come down.
a view. This arch was made after the earthquake 1755. There is an elevator, so go up and enjoy a wonderful sight of Lisbon and the Tagus. Truly beautiful.

Great view over Terreiro do Paço Square. Inside the building there is an exhibition about the rebuilding of Lisbon downtown after the earthquake and you can also see the mechanism of the Rua Augusta arch's clock. Upstairs you'll find an awesome view of Lisbon, the castle, the river. It's a beautiful terrace with a view.
Fabulous spot in Lisbon. Beautiful arch and a nice atmosphere with a great view I'd the river. Not too many people around and a nice spot for photos.

Lovely square and view in Lisboa!. One of the most beautiful city squares in the world! A visit to the impressive arch offers interesting piece of history and a wonderful view over Lisboa and the river! Don't miss it!

Nice to see on the way to something else. It is a picturesque and impressive arch leading to the Praça Comércio. There isn't much to do at the site other than admiring its splendour. However, there is plenty to see in the area and you won't be disappointed.

Good short visit. A short visit but one which is well priced and offers a nice introduction to Lisbon. Interesting architecture, lovely views and well contextualized with historical panels. Ultimately, it's the price of a beer and probably going to create more interesting memories...

Beautiful square. Great place to visit - the square in front of the arch is beautiful, great views all around ... The arch is a lively place in itself and with the walking street with live music, street artists etc there's lots of things to look at and enjoy!

Breath-taking view. This one is a must see. The entrance fee is only 2.50€, you'll need to go up a couple flight of stairs to reach the top. It offers a panoramic view of the entire town, as beautiful in the day as at night.

What a site. This monument today presents the entry to the baixa zone of Lisbon. The baixa was destroyed during the 1755 earthquake. Marques de Pombal remodeled and rebuilt the city. You will enjoy this view many times as its located by a huge square near the Tejo river. Its a must. Put it on your check list

Good miradouro. Paid the 2.50€ entry to go up to the viewing deck on top of the arch. There was a lift for part of the way up which was nice. Unique view of the Praca do Comercio from the Arco which you cannot get anywhere else. Also there are good views of the castelo, Elevador da Santa Justa and Convento do Carmo in the distance. Would recommend but not my favourite miradouro of the city.

What a view. The Arch stands right at the beginning of the walking section of Biaxo. When you are there the city climbs before you and the beautiful waters of the bay are at your back. Very nice place to drink in the atmosphere.

You must go to the top. The arch is the gateway to Lisbon's post-earthquake city, built in the huge Praça do Comércio/Terreiro do Paço. This square opens to the Tagus river and the Arch front it in its northern side.You can pay 2,5€ (as of 2015) to climb to the top, but it is a must. The view from up there is simply unbeatable! You can take in all the area that was destroyed in the great earthquake/fire/tsunami of 1755 and reconstructed by Marques de Pombal.There is a lift to the top

Stunning 360º view of downtown Lisbon. Arco (Arch of) da Rua Augusta was built to be a symbol of the triumphal rebirth of the city of Lisbon after the terrible earthquake that devastated the city in 1755.Since August 2013 it is possible to visit the top of this monument and enjoy a spectacular view of Lisbon - Castelo de S. Jorge, Rua Augusta, Cais das Colunas, Praça do Comércio.
Beautiful. Very beautiful and detailed arch, both during the day but more so at night when fully lit up. Both sides of the arch are gorgeous.
Great place to visit. The arch is amazing and surrounded by great restaurants! if your goal is to take pictures do it anytime other than sunset because the pictures will turn out very dark.

Impressive. Large and impressive arc near the large commercial square. It looks like it is well preserved. Walking toward the square, it looks pretty as it opens into the wide square and the water. The street in the other side is full of shopping and places to eat as well.

Impressive Arch monument and near river promenade. From our cruise ship we walked to the Arco Triunfal da Rua Agusta which was about a 30 minute walk through busy streets. Then we walked along the river promenade back to the ship before heading out for our bus tour of Lisbon. There are small cafes and stores around this area. Near this arch you will find hop on hop off tour buses and also the historic trolley cars.

Lisbon visit. Here for day from cruise ship,area flat which is hard to find in Lisbon,nice views over river and the tourist office has all novelty gifts,fine of chocolate sardines etc,I was disappointed in shopping in this area but we had a wheelchair user with us,had nice day out,coffee and pastries cheap
Lots of cafes and restaurant.. When you are walking in downtown Lisbon this street is called Rua Augusta and its close to traffic it will take you a good 1/2 hour to go from top to bottom.
Malls and shops. There is a lot of shopping to do here. Nice restaurants and coffee shops. Lots of antique stores on sidewalk at the time I visited Lisbon. Busy street and near the Tagus Bridge.
You will not miss it!. Go down Rua Augusta to Praca dos Comercios an you will not miss this amazing building. It is impossible not to take a good picture there
Great. Great Arch overlooking the artory of Lisbons rua de Augusto. When walking underneath from the praça do comercio you get the awe of entering the main streets where everything feels alive.
The gate of the shopping street. The gate of the shopping street, the Arc of Rua Augusra can be seen form the pedestrian street and from the Placa de Comercui as well. It's a grandious view.
Nice area. Hotel was near the arc so we ate on augusta street almost every night. Arc is beautiful and worth the time to visit

Good viewing spot. 11 meter high, 6 column the statistical datas of this nice arch. 4 statue - Pombal marquis, Vasco da Gama and the Tej and Douro rivers. You can see them very close, if you go up to the top of the arch. You have a wonderful view from above, you think you can reach by hand the river and the whole inner city.

Beautiful arch. It's an emotion to reach Commerce Square (a Praça do Comércio) walking down Rua Augusta e through the Arch, that frames the Tejo River...enchanting, for the ones the have the eyes to see.

Impressive Views from the Top. A very impressive structure well worth a visit. There is a fee to go to the roof top but it-s well worth it as the views are phenomenal. You can see the Santa Justa Lift Ticket, Sao Jorge, churches, etc., from the top. For $2.50€ you can’t go wrong.
Rúa Augusta. From far away you see the"Arco" triumphantly opening the city on the Tagus banks, such beauty, such majesty...beautiful perspective.
Nice at sunset. a nice place to become nostalgic, overlooking the "Praça do comercio" and the Tagus river on one side and the shopping streetRua Augusta on the other.

Impressive arch. We visited during our re-positioning cruise on the Celebrity Equinox in May, 2015.
This impressive arch was right in the heart of the city and worth taking a photo opportunity. The flow of walking traffic goes under it and the clock had accurate time.

Awesome, if limited, view. Saw the arco from afar, and found it really cool that we could just go on up for cheap (€2,50). The walk itself was an experience because of the tight, winding staircases. The view at the top was awesome! Plus seeing the huge statues up close was great. Although, given that I'm not very tall, it was hard to see a lot of things. Glad I went up though, it introduced me to much of Lisbon, and I was able to get a good look at certain points of interest that I wanted to visit.
Well worth a visit. This is just north of the Praca do Comercio. For a small fee, you can climb up onto the roof for a great view of the square itself and the Baixa district.

Horse and Rider. The statue takes pride of place in the Plaza Commercia, and leads to the central pedestrian shopping street in Lisbon. The square the statue and the Archway are all beautiful, and the view through the arch in either direction gives great views of Lisbon street, or the river.
Was beautiful. Was a really nice walk down from Rossio square. The gateway is fantastic, nice place to go. Lots of places to stop and have a coffee to take in the sights

Fabulous views of Baixa and the river Tejo. Right there in the heart of Baixa Pombalina, the center of the city, you can enjoy the outstanding presence of Lisbon´s Triumphal Arch. It´s quite cheap to go up and enjoy a fab view of the river Tagus, the castle or the typical pavement design in Praça do Comércio, were afterwards you may even enjoy a drink in one of the nice restaurants and esplanades. Not to be missed !
Very impressive! You can't miss it!. The square next to it used to be used for a huge parking lot but they realized it is better used as the way into the shopping street.

it's nice, but nothing special. when you first see it it's nice to see, but then that fades away and its nothing really special, right next to the beach, shops and metro/train station though so that's nice.
Great place to quickly see incredible views for low price. only €2.5 and no wait at all. Incredible 360 degree views and an excellent location for hopping on the tram to see another part of the city.
One of the must see in Lisbon!. Amazing building, next to the Tagus (Tejo) river... definitly a must to see and an amazing spot to take pictures.

Nice Video Show. You can't miss this, as it stands out at the end of the pedestrian walking street in Lisbon. It is very pretty and nice to go to the top and enjoy the panoramic views of the ocean, the ships and the Christ. Lots of stairs, or you can take the elevator up.

Best 360 view of the city!. The beautiful day given to us made time spent at the top a view to remember. Lisbon is just so beautiful and so panoramic frames were great, the view of the bay with the bridge and Christ the Redeemer in the distance on a clear day from that point was fantastic. I don't think it's fair to say it's just an arch, it's an arch with a wonderful view.

Another arque de triumphe. We reached gthe location after seeing it on our way to our hotel/A tuk tuk took us to the location.The arco-a monument woth seeing.The Rua Agusta , a disappointment.Not what one would expect from a shopping area.And as my friend pointed out - a pedestrian Area w/o even one Macdonald's?
A different view of Lisbon's downtown. Great view of Rua Augusta, Terreiro do Paço and Tagus river. It is a bit narrow to get to the top through the stairs, but worth it!

Beautiful, just above the huge seaside plaza. The grand arch and entry is a fitting greeting when coming off the lovely, huge seaside plaza and starting up Lisbons pedestrian shopping street. We were fortunate to do our 1st visit late afternoon and learn of the giant video/ sound show that evening, which drew us back at 9:30 pm . The projected lights and images across the arch & adjacent building fronts was spectacular.
Just an arch. It's a nice piece of architecture but it's not out of this world. I recommend seeing it as you go shopping but I wouldn't make a special trip just for this.

Superb views. A magnificent arch with access to a viewing level and 360 views. There is a lift to the 2nd level, then 79 steps to the top up a narrow spiral staircase, controlled by traffic lights to avoid accidents. On a clear day the views up Rua Augusta to Rossio, and to Castelo Sao Jorge are beautiful and also over Praça Comercio to the harbour. Tickets were €2.50 and worth it.

Brilliant white giant. You cannot miss this beautiful white arch that dominates the entrance to the commercial square. View it from both sides and examine the complex details. As the area gets quite busy, it will be difficult to get distance photos without people in them. Busses and trams stop nearby as this is a major landmark of Lisbon. Once in the square, it is surrounded by many restaurants and shops. Walk to the end and you are at the ocean.
Never tire of the views. Love the views from the top of the arch along with the sculptured ropes and the bell. Gazing over the panorama of roofs in Lisbon encapsulates the appeal of this city.
Triumphal Arch. Really impressive, from both ends.huge, white and busy. Best viewed from the square. Look at the detail and look from a distance.

Amazing view over Lisbon. For only 2,50 euros you can get one of the best views of Lisbon without having to wait for hours in line! I went there twice at different times of the day (early afternoon and early evening) and there were no more than 3 other people.
Don't miss it.

Beautiful!. The Arco Triumphal is very beautiful. It leads on Praia de commerco.
Only downside is its very touristy area with alot of peddlers and shady characters

Beautiful Architecture!. We didn't tour it or anything, but just walked around outside and gazed at this stunning monument. Definitely take the time to check it out. If nothing else, there are plenty of great food stops and shopping boutiques to hit up while you're there!

Eye catching. Submerge yourself in what this beautiful monument has to offer. Very nice spot to grab a coffee.
Beware the hasheesh men.
Nice monument. Nice to se, also the streets around it are worth viewing. Recommend going early to avoid crowds. Restaurant s nearby are a bit more expensive though
Amazing little gem. Don't understand why this place was so quiet, 2.5 euros for one of the best views in Lisbon. You can see everything... don't miss it if you are in Lisbon
Can't miss it!. This is a very beautiful and unique monument. in fact all the square where it is locates is fantastic. Check also teh cafes And Rua Augusta.

For €2.50, the elevator to the top of the Arco Triunfal should not be missed.... For €2.50, the elevator to the top of the Arco Triunfal should not be missed, as it offers brilliant 360 degree views of Lisbon. The Arco Triunfal is tucked at the southern end of one of the most beautiful Augusta pedestrian streets in Lisbon, which starts at Rossio square. The staff here are friendly, and afterwards, you can cross the street, and have a glass of wine in front of the Atlantic Ocean, at one of the many outdoor cafes.

Great views. A couple of euros and you're in, You get the most amazing views if you manage to make it to the top. Wear comfy shoes as its quite a hike and a lot of steps.Its not the nicest looking arch, its not Paris remember but it does have a lovely humble charm. Lisbon is a lovely city and it seems content to stay in the past.Very city central. Well worth a visit,

Makes for a Nice Photo. While there are more dramatic and beautiful and larger arches, this one is pretty nice. I you stand on Via Augusta towards the river, there;s as nice a photo as I can imagine and I'm not very creative. It's on every tourist's walk so you can't miss it.
Amasing view. Nice and convenient in the center of the city, Excellent place for panoramic pictures from the top. Possible combination with the ticket for Lisbon story center (8 EUR)

Great Views of Comercio Square. To pay €2.50 for these views is an amazing deal! It's an elevator ride up most of the way and some stairs (including a narrow spiral staircase, warning to the claustrophobic). The top is open and you can see over Comercio square and the water and all of the town to the other side. Worth a stop!

greatest view of lisbon. The renewed Archway is now open to the public. Enter through Rua Augusta, take the elevator and then climb the staircase (make sure you press the green light as this is a sign that you have a free passage going up, or down afterwards). The view is STUNNING! It is said that this archway reveals that the whole downtown area of Lisbon is actually devoted to the masonic lodge.

Arco triunfal da rua Augusta. Great view of the Tagus and south bank of the river and the Praça do Comércio from one side and from the other, a beautiful view from Lisbon downtown's rooftops and streets, mainly the Rua Agusta. The entrance is cheap for the beautiful view, its a perfect place to visit during a stroll in downtown Lisbon.
Nice view. Nice and well known place in Lisbon with really nice view over the river and Rua Augusta. From the top of the arc we have a different perception about Lisboa. It must be experienced
Just Rose is wonderful!!. Magnificent monument and I advise you to pay 2.50 euro to go up there, the view is breathtaking. There is a lift and then a small spiral staircase but it is really worth.

A new and different way of seeing Lisbon. Not that usual seeing Lisbon from the bottom to the top this monument allow us to have a different perpective of this amazing city. For the price it is 5 stars and you will take amazing photos from the top of this arch
Nice. Not special.. Nice surprise at the end of Rua Augusta shopping street. Not very special. You can go to the top but we didn't do that.

Iconic Arch!(Is a Must). This is an iconic place to visit while in lisbon, it have a sightseeing balcony for a few euros, but i dont think is worthed paying to visit this seightseeing mirador since is too low and after being at Santa Justa lift that is 3 times taller is completely pointless paying for going to a lower spot. But is worthed a few pictures and is a must in your Lisbon trip!For the arch structure itself you dont need to pay, so you can just visit without any charge, just going to the mirador cost you around 5 euros.
Nice overview. Nice, not very crowded spot to overview and understand the downtown area and plan, also excellent view of the river and Lisbon city hills.

Great monument. We stumble across this amazing piazza after getting off the 28 tram. If you're standing with the river behind you looking at the monument you can see lots of open air cafes to the right of the piazza, and narrow roads facing you full of shops. Great place for shopping, eating and drinking.

Good alternative to the Elevador. No queues or crowds, €2.50 entry, great views and the chance to see the statue and clock movement up close. If the queues are long at the Elevador Santa Justa this is a better bet.
Big surprise. Having been a downtown lover I finally decided to climb and take a look at the view... You can see forever from up there! It great! And the statues, carved to perfection...

Doorway to Commercial Square. This is the Arch that leads to the Commercial Square. It is relatively small, not the most imposing or that noteworthy but Rua Augusta is probably the most interesting street (stretching from Rossio Sq to Commercial Sq.) It is lined with shops and eateries and pulses with the spirit of Lisbon. A must for any first-time visitor to Lisbon. It is also a central point to start exploring the barrios of Alfama, Barrio Alto, Baxia and Castle Sao Jorge
great attraction. A triumphal arch, amazing attraction on Commerce Square. Surprising place, the area is unbelievable. Spend some time in there to feel the place.

Marvelous!. I had seen the Arch on travel shows before we visited and wasn't disappointed! It is magnificent to see, as well as the statute in the square. I am almost more amazed that my Fodor's travel book barely gives it a mention! I thought I must have missed something, oh well, it's a must see, regardless.

Wonderful. What a lovely entrance into the square and view out to the estuary. It is very majestic and welcoming. The whole structure and decorations are fantastic. Spend some time absorbing it if you can.
A triumph for the people. pedestians pass through this arch at the foot of Rua Augusta to make their own grand entry into the expanse of the Praca do Comercio and views of the river beyond.

A small pleasure !. You want to feel you know your way around Lisbon? so visit the Arch, go into the small side-door pay the small fee, and enjoy one of the best views of the city of Lisbon you can take. Imagine the past of this historic city, the stories among the place! It is certainly a small pleasure to be able to enjoy the view!
Place to see when visiting Lisbon. Traditional old central square. Somehow we found our way there several times and always found something new from the streets surrounding it.
Lovely View. A fantastic view of Tagus river and all down town Lisbon. A place you should visit in Lisbon. There's also a lot to see nearby.

Great Start!. Hello Travellers here´s a good place to go shopping, eat, drink, walk, you can choose many thing to do starting in downtown. This is a Excellent starting point to go to St George Castle, Alfama, Chiado, Terreiro do Paco Bairro Alto etc.
Go and explore it
Recomend it!!

Impressive landmark. This intricately carved monument is an impressive sight in Lisbon. We walked past it many times during our stay and at no time did we see that you could climb to the top.....missed that sadly...maybe next time!

Lovely Arc with views to the ocean & beyong. I loved this place, it opens to the ocean, great picture spot, Rua Augusta ends here and it hosts many restaurants and cafes. Must visit for a walk down and around it.

Look up, way up. We walked by this tourist attraction and ended up staying for a while. This Arch was built to commemorate the city's reconstruction after the 1755 earthquake. It has six huge stone columns (some 11 m high) plus the statues of various historical figures. We had to look up, way up to see this attraction.On the side facing Rua Augusta is an intricately designed monumental clock, don’t miss this photo opportunity.After shopping you can relax at the other side facing the Commerce Square and River Tajo.Happy travelling!
Impressive view. From the top you get a really nice view on the main Lisbon avenue and on Praça do comercio. Worth to visit and its just a few euros to get access to it.

Interesting street. Rua Agusta has lots of cafes, restaurants, shops at both sides of the street and it's strictly pedestrian only. Here's where all the actions are. It's nice to just sit in one of the cafe and watch people walking up and down the street, especially on a nice sunny day.

Great walk. An impressive landmark. We started the walk at Praça D. Pedro IV, where there is a beautiful fountain. We walked up Augusta st to Praça do Comercio. On a Beautiful sunny day, great riverview.
A impressive sight. A place to watch the world walk by, seems to a gateway into the lower city. As impressive as Paris though not as large.

Impressive river view. This arch is closely connected with Lisbon's history and has accompanied the city evolution through time. If you climb to the top you will be able to have a magnificent view of both parts of the town and the river, including bridges, quays and what not. For people with disability the elevator doesn't take you right up to the top so take that into consideration. Also it is a bit windy over there :) so take care with hats and scarves. It's a good point to start a visit to Lisbon's riverbanks, and it's part of the shop district so lots of stores both high end, lux and artisan crafts. There's a lot of cafes and restaurants close by and you can catch a bus from here to other parts of town.

Lovely spot.... The first thing we saw on our arrival in Lisbon... the gate to Praca do Comercio... the street to reach the Arc is full of shops and street perfromers and it's definitely very vibrant...

Beautiful!!!. A beautifull view of Lisboa and of it's Tejo river...
A great and diferente view of Castelo de S. Jorge... A must in Lisboa!
Very cool area in Lisbon. This is a must see spot in Lisbon. Right next to the beach and surrounded by a lot of restaurants and shops. Very nice area.

The Arco Triunfal. Well, At the end of Rua Augusta you can find the Arco Triunfal (the arch of triumph), which was intended to be a decorative element to praca de comercio (commerce square), where government buildings were (and some still are) located while Lisbon was being reconstructed after the 1755 earthquake. It was built in the 19th century, It's also known by the name of arco de Augusta
Great people watching area. The street leading up to the arch is filled with people strolling and street performers. The square is particularly beautiful at night when lit up.

A really nice view to oldtown lisbon. You must visit inside and paying like 2 euros you can go upstais and enjoy a nice view of the old streets (renascentista arquitecthure) as well as have great pictures

Fantastic views of the city. As expected the views from the top of the Arco Triunfal are fantastic, but what made it an even more enjoyable experience was the relative ease you felt in getting to the top. Not only is it only a couple of Euro to go to the top, you enter through a very well managed entrance to a speedy lift which takes you most of the way up. This means that there is only a small amount of stair climbing to be done. They also have a clever traffic light system which allows visitors to indicate when they are coming up or down the steps, as they are only wide enough for one flow of people.That having been said, I would still definitely say that if you find walking difficult or get out of breath from a flight of stairs, that this is not the attraction for you (which is a shame).Once up there you can spend as much or as little time as you want admiring the remarkable views of such a beautiful city. Naturally it is a great place for photos, esp of Rua Augusta and Praca do Comercio.
Hard to miss if downtown. Beautiful area - Arc is full of spectacular detail and is the centerpiece of the boardwalk. Lots to do in the area

Fantastic view from the top. Only cost us €2.50 each to go to the top. There is a lift to the clock room and then some narrow spiral stairs to the roof look out..Great views over the Praça do Comércio and up Rua Augusta the other way.Well worth visiting.

The most famous and lively street in Lisbon. Rua Augusta broadwalk is definitely one of must-see places in Lisbon. You can find here plenty of restaurants, shops (with traditional Portuguese wines and ports) and street artits. Of course it is necessary to mention about the amazing Arco Triunfal. I was really impressed how beautiful and huge is the arch.

A walk... The arch has been under reconstruction.
Now its a great place to visit and to go right up to a have a great view of Lisbon and the river. You can see 360 all around :)
Really beautiful. It's a brilliant arc! the all street is just mngnificent and then you get to this La creme! Amazing!
View from the top. That's possible to get to the arch roof and there's a beatiful view out of there. There's a lift there, and some very small exhibition inside.

This thing is massive! . You can see the arch from quite a ways. I was on my way to a massage parlor I had read about here on TA and I look to my right and it just hit me in the face. Considering how old it is, it is in such great condition and fantastic picture taking opportunities exist with this arch. You can climb to the top I believe for about 5 euros. I didn't do it. I wanted to get the pictures from the outside instead of above.

Lovely area and great photo opportunities . Lovely area with lots going on and some great views. Make sure you get some good pictures as it's hard to describe how pretty the buildings are. Worth a walk around the area to explore a little.
Wonderful view. It is now one of the places where climbing to the top you can enjoy a wonderful panoramic view of the area of downtown Lisbon and where the city touches the Tejo river.

Magnanimous!. Strolling down the Rua Augusta you will find the Arco Triunfal. On the otsher side de magnanimous Praça do Comercio and the Tagus River. If in Lisbon no way arround this visit if you are into history and pompous monuments.

High up, above the crowds - for superb views in all directions!. Walk from Praco do Comercio (Black Horse Square as it is known by many Brits), go through the arch and turn immediate right to find the entrance - it's easy to miss this as there are often handicraft stalls in front which can distract you. The entrance fee is a very reasonable €2.50, money well spent! There is an internal lift which whizzes you up to floor 2, where the spiral staircase starts. Press the button and wait for the green light before ascending the first set of stairs (these are very narrow and so you can only go one at a time). After viewing the clock mechanisms and displays in the upper chamber, press the button on the upper set of stairs before ascending to the roof of the arch. Prepare to be astounded - the views are superb in all directions! By the way, the upper terrace is well protected by a high, and thick wall, giving a feeling of security and also protection from the wind which can be strong.
Arco da Rua Augusta. Really nice, great pictures of downtown you can take, sorry that new stores are taking the place of the old traditional ones from the street

Impressive. Beautiful and magnificent structure that leads you to Praça do Comercio (Market Square), and other beatiful places in the area. And you can always go up there to get a beautiful of the city.

great place to catch a break. visited many places that day and wanted to catch a break and have a quick lunch so we did come here, many restaurants near by and you can enjoy the view while eating,great resting place in busy day

Really good thing to do. We bought a combined ticket for the Arco Triunfal and the Lisbon Story Centre, which was really good value. Being at the top of the Arco was excellent: one of three great views we enjoyed over Lisbon (the other two being the Castelo Sao Jorges and the Santa Justa Elevator).A lift takes you most of the way, then there are a few more flights of stairs. You feel very 'centred' at the top - after all, you are at the point where the Pombaline Baixa (the world's first modern city layout) meets the massive Placa de Commercio.You can ring a bell (at least, we think we were allowed!) and just soak in the views.There is a little bit of interpretation about the creation of the Arco one floor down - but a white font on a silver background isn't a great idea!
Nice walk. Very nice site and the surroundings of a delightful neighbourhood. Walk around, go till the Tejo riverside, turn around and go to the streets nearby. Do not forget to go to the berr museum
Makes a great photo. We did not bother to go to the top, instead we just looked from the ground. It is a great work of art and makes a good picture
spectacular views of the city and the river. The trip up the arch is very easy (elevator) and very cheap. The view is fantastic and it is definitely worth it.

Great views of the city center. We started our visit of Lisbon by spending 2.50 euros to take the elevator to the top of the Arc. It was a great view of the city center and the Praca do Comercio. There are also great views from the Castle (which is more expensive) and other lookout points which are free, but the Arc was a great way to start our sightseeing. We enjoyed looking down on the Arc from the Castle and seeing how much higher up we were there!

Average compared to other cities. This is a nice attraction in a beautiful square but if you compare to Paris, London, or other cities it is not that amazing. The best part is it is in a beautiful square right on the river and there are great restaurants and sites in the area.

Nice view. After having a walk in rua Augusta i went to visit this nice Miradouro. The view is amazing and its a nice way to finish the afternoon. A litle bit expensive but because you only go there once dont miss.
Nice historical area. Lisbon have kept the old fashioned look and feel of this area. The whole area was very nice with old trams that are still used for transport and the tuktuk tricycle!

It is open!. Wasn't the last time but the repairs are made and it is open for only a few euros. There are a few steps to climb, but nothing bothersome. Awesome views of the city, castle, river, bridge, and more. The only thing that could make it disappointing is if it rains.

Give it a try. Nice view, at the end of one of the main streets (shopping one, pedestrian, lots and lots of stores) leading to the river. On the weekend just after it there is a local market for handmade stuff. Also see the monument after it leading to the river and walk along the water for some spectacular views of the other part of the city
Can't miss it. If you visit central Lisbon, you can't miss this monumental architecture. It connects the river with the square and the shopping area.
Lovely architecture. A lovely building leading to a square full of shops and restaurants. Nice for a wander. Right near the sea so you can visit the sea too.

Nice city view, well organized, good price. For € 2,50 each we took the entrance and the elevator to the top: very easy! First we reached the clockhouse step-by-step upstairs. From there we found another very small stairway to the roof with a monument. Fantastic city-view to every side! You can see the castle, the Tejo, the famous bridge and the christ monument on the other side of the river. No shelter on the top when it rains. Then use the clockhouse with the little exhibition. Attention: at the staircases - there are small signals: green is for going; red for waiting. We could recommend this experience.
a walk to the river. Take a walk from Rossio to the river (Praca do Comercio). You will need to walk under this beautiful arch. Breathtaking views.
Beautiful arch. The arch is beautiful and huge. It's located near the Praça do Comércio (Comercio Square), that's another fantastic place to see. Recommended!

we stayed at the hotel mundial. a short walk from our hotel this as a lot to offer from museums shops and restaurants to a walk across the square to the sea front to watch the sun go down worth going to
Nice sight. Enjoy great views over Lisbon and praça do Comercio. No access for disabled people to the because of the stairs
Grand Archway. Situated in the Praca do Comercio the Arco is an impressive sight. Take a trip to the top for views of the square. The statues on top of the Arc are huge when you get up close to them.
Impressive. Handsomely made and very beatiful. Situated between "Praça do Comércio" and Rua Augusta, one of the main streets of the city center

Great View and Open Space. We were quite I pressed with the size of this square. We also loved how all the shops are around the outside of it and there is very little busking or other activities in the middle. Just a nice spot to hang out.

Great view and square. The Arc is situated on really spacious square that leads you to the ocean. The view is great, especially at sunset. During the say it could be very sunny, but its worth seeing it.
Newly opened. Wonderful views over Waterfront. Very cheap. Great photo opportunities at sunset. Restaurants nearby.
Nice view!. It's a new viewing point and it's great! It has a little history resume about the meaning behind the Triumph Arch!

Lovely. Gutted that we only saw this place properly on the last day.
As you go under the arch and pass the big square there is the sea area, we sat there and watch the sea along with other people while a gentleman sung the best songs (in English)

Imposing. It gives you the feeling that this is the "door" to enter the historic center of Lisbon and this is indeed true. It is very impressive and prepares you appropriately for what you are going to experience walking around the beautiful historic center of Lisbon.

Wasn't Expecting it. I was truly surprised when I saw this phenomenal structure. It isn't as grand as the actual arc de triumph in Paris but is worth some photos and you can go up in it for some good views of Baixa.
A majestic view. Enjoy the perfect alignment from Rua Augusta all the way to Praca do comercio. It is the heart of Lisbon's tourism, which can be an inconvenient.

Beautiful view. The arc is stunning and over looks the square and sea on one side and the city's bustling neighbourhood on the other. You could actually go up to the top. The entry is about 2 euros and you get an aerial view of the city square. All the tourist trams and open air buses start near the arc and there is a small shop across which sells the local cherry liquor or gijinia

The magnificent symbol of Lisbon's rebirth!. The magnificent "Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta" symbolizes the rebirth of Lisbon after the terrible 1755 earthquake. Its construction, in neoclassical style, lasted 100 years - from 1775 to 1875! Amazing and beautiful results! Take the lift - at an E$ 2,50 fee - and enjoy, from its terrace, a 360º view of Lisbon and its main monuments. The arch connects monumental "Praça do Comércio", on the banks of "Rio Tejo" (Tagus River), to "Rua Augusta", a pedestrian street and main gate to the "Baixa Pombalina" quarter: the pumping heart of Lisbon! Enjoy!

Arch + old town. First impression arriving in lisbon wasnt the best - reminded huge cities where cars on streets are more than people,but when we got to old town,our worry of disappointment dissappeared.old town and arch as part of it looms great and lisbon became my favourite city of trip (madrid-porto-lisbon-lagos)

Worth a Visit. Only 2.50 euro to visit top of arch for fantastic views. Elevator takes you up most of the way then a few sets of stairs to reach top. We visited around 10am and had the place to ourselves, not sure if many people know you can visit, I wasn't aware just happened to see sign advertising. Anyway if you don't mind heights I would recommend a visit.

A must see. Its is so beautiful you cannot miss it. Go upstairs and take a look of the Tagus River and historic neibourghoods around, I recommend it in early mornings or late afternoons, when the light is at that point that makes Lisbon unique. And don't forget your camera, you will want to remember it!

2 euro 50 cents, money well spent. Have looked at the arch for many years and now the chance to actually stand on top. Brilliant experience,the views offered make for stunning photos . To see the square and streets from a different viewpoint add to a very nice experience. No time limit on how long you stay,so just ascend and city and people watch. Lovely in the sun.

It is magestic. This Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta is indeed a majestic arch and it is at the end of a very busy and interesting Augusta street and the the heart of Lisbon. It nice to go up and see a beautiful scenary with the Tagus (Tejo) river at the bottom of your feet.
Impressive. Very impressive building and the escape way from the shopping frenzy at Rua Augusta on to the wide Praca do Comercio to give you and your bank account a breezer.

Opulent View. Walking down the Rua Augusta is like we are in another world,lots of tourists,many esplanades restaurant ,coffee shops,pastry shops beautiful stores for every tasty,then going through the Arco Triunfal is a beautiful site very unique,so must to admire and to see it is mesmerizing.

Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta. A fitting entrance to the old waterfront of Lisbon - how many stories this Arch could tell! Each time I visit Lisbon I take yet another photos of this amazing arch. The carvings are sublime.

Really worth it. This is a little known (yet) attraction in Lisbon, it opened quite recently and I think tourists haven't quite heard about it yet; but it's really worth it. For 2,5€ (if I am not mistaken) you can climb to the top of the Arch of Rua Augusta and have a unique view of the Terreiro do Paço and of Rua Augusta itself. There are a couple of long flights of stairs to get to the top, so this attraction may not be suitable for elderly people or for people with mobility limitations.
beautiful arch. nice arch overlooking the big & beautiful square of Praca do Commercio, joing the square with the main street rua Augusta

Stunning views. A must do! Beautiful 360 views from here and the arch itself is really quirky and beautiful inside and out. The winding staircase to the to the top is very narrow and an adventure. Well worth going

Hidden Gem - amazing 360º degrees view of Lisbon. I highly recommend visiting the Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta tower. It only costs 2.50 euro and has fantastic views!! The elevator takes you up the majority of the way and then 2 stairwells take you to the top. They have a cool red light/green light system for their oneway stairwells so that you don't run into someone walking the opposite way.Skip the Santa Justa Elevator and come here instead!!
Different view of Lisbon. Friendly staff, a 360º quick view from Lisbon with other prespective!After to be on the top, just choose wich attraction you should choose next!!!

Stunning Arch at the end of a busy shopping district. The arch dominates the end of the Rua Augusta and has the added advantage of a lift which takes you to the top for a fantastic view of the the Terreiro do Paco overlooking the Rio Tejo

Triumphal arche!. The Rua Augusta Arch is a stone, triumphal arch-like, historical building and visitor attraction in Lisbon, Portugal, on Commerce Square, built to commemorate the city's reconstruction after the 1755 earthquake. The four statues over the columns, represent Nuno Alvares Pereira and Sebastião José de Carvalho e Melo, Marquis of Pombal on the right, and Vasco da Gama and Viriatus on the left. The two recumbent figures represent the rivers Tagus and Douro.

Start of a great pedestrian only fun zone. Beautiful arch building at the entrance of pedestrian only zone. Closed to car traffic, this opens into an area filled with many shops and cafes. Took pictures of the entry way but did not go up the Arch for the view.
Wonderful view. This newly-opened attraction has a great view of the Praça do Comércio. It has a lift that takes you to the top.

Nice view, and no lines.. Visited this seeing as how it was just down the street from our hotel, and it was a nice view on the top. Payed 2,5 euro p.p(I think), and you take the elevator up to the upper levels. Here you will be greeted by a green-red light that indicates wether or not the small stairs going up are free. After walking the first set of stairs, you come to a large room with some historical information, before you walk up another set of stairs. Not sure if there is any way for people that need weelchair(or people that have problems walking up stairs in general) to get up to the top.When you get to the top, you will have a 360 degree view of the harbour/baixa/centre. The view is nice, and there is no time limit on your stay up there.

Nice 360º degrees view of old Lisbon center. I saw in the news during our holidays that the Arch was open to the public and we decided to go there.We went before lunch and there were not too many people. We bought the tickets, went up on the elevator and then the rest till the top is on foot in a narrow stairway. It is easy to climb and so worth it!The view is very nice, the Tagus river, the bridge, Almada and Cristo Rei on one side and old Lisbon on the other, with S.Jorge Castle and the Cathedral.
What a view.... open since a year, offer a 360° view on all part of the old Lisboa. Nice light at the end of the day

Amazing view over Lisbon and Tagus. It's an amazing experience. It opened again just last summer after reconstraction. It has an amazing view and definately worth it. You must visit it only to see Lisbon unite with Tagus river up until where your eye can catch.

Wonderful view to Terreiro do Paco and far... Very reasonable price for a beautiful view of this fantastic city and Terreiro do Paco. Our kids had a lot of fun ringing the bell on top. Not to be missed.

Lisbon. Nice place not expensive plus loads to see Good idea if you are in a hire car park at the airport 13 Euros for 24 hours then get the bus into town 8 Euros for 4 people
The old part of Lisbon is nice and take the tram or tuk tuk uo to The Castle of St George

Nice view. The Rua Augusta Arch is a stone, triumphal arch-like, historical building on Commerce Square, built to commemorate the city's reconstruction after the 1755 earthquake .
Worth to see
Lovely. Very impressive, once at the top beautiful views on the square below, the sea and along the Rua Augusta.

A place to visit. Just, take the profit to climb on theis maginficent and well placed place to have a good look for the center of Lisbon and have and insight how Lisbon have been rebuilt after teh hearthquake.
very nice. IT looks great especially at sunset time... I walked there every day and enjoyed it really. Rua Augusta is pedestrian steet and you can enjoy walking there. Just be aware of pickpockets...
Superb. This seems to be a copy of the arc de triomphe in Paris. The big difference is that you have a magnificant look over the Tagus and the square.

The Southern entrance to lovely Augusta street. The composition of being at the Southern end of the loveliest street of Lisbon and the continuation of the big commercial square in between this Arch and the river, makes this monument a MUST to visit for any traveler. It is seen from the Rosio square and all the way when walking along the beautiful Augusta pedestrian street.

Good for a few photos. You cannot miss the arch as you are strolling the Rua Augusta towards to Praca do Comercio waterfront plaza area. The reality is that the arch -- huge, imposing, detailed -- makes for some good pictures. But that is about it. Your time related to the arch is just the few minutes it takes to walk around the approaches and snap a few pix.
Great view!. This attraction is located in centre of the town, and provides a spectacular 360 degree view over the whole city. Only 2.50€. Dont miss it!

Important Attraction. Here you can appreciate the old architecture, old sculptures, really good sights of Lisbon. You shouldnt miss this location as it contains a lot of history of LIsbon. The Archway is an icon of Lisbon that you have to visit.
Grand!. Archway that is standing over the lower walking street and to the gateway to the ocean. Old architecture, nice sculptures, nice entrance to the city of Lisbon.
great site al Praca do Comercio. the view, the movement, access to rua augusta and several historics sites like praca do rossio and av Liberdade

Simply beautiful!. You can't miss this in Lisbon as it's on the main street in the downtown area called the Baixa.. It's located at the end of Rua Augusta opening up to a large square in front of the Tagus river!
Another triumphal arc. Don't see any special in this arc. All attraction at Praca do Commercial is not very special in my opinion. However you can't miss this part of the city.

not to miss...... love this area, close to the water and the middle part is so huge, they were watching world cup when we went there to visit. set up a gigantic screen and people were just dropping in and sat down to watch the game. local restaurant everywhere and u can watch while eating dinner. or u can just watch boats coming and going.

Great viw. We bought the combined ticket of Rua Augusta and Lisbon Story great value and both are worth the visit from the top of the arch the view of Lisbon is fantastic and you get to see the statues up close and they are beautiful.This a visit that everyone should make, and the Lisbon story is very well made because you get to see lisbon before the hearth quake and it's restoration and you learn the history of the city.
Beautiful View. It's a beautiful view over Lisbon, outstanding view over Tagus River. After go and walk aside the river to end a perfect day watching the sunset over 25 April's Bridge. Just lovevly.

Great view. We wanted to go to the Lisbon Story Centre and there was a combination ticket to go up the arch for an additional couple of Euros. It was definitely worth it. There were some great views up there!
Rua Augusta. during the night there are people singing, its a nice place for spending time, Rua Augusta its a interesting place for walking
Very nice. An huge arch limiting a wonderful square. From there you can take buses that go everywhere. This place is always full of people even in a rainy day!

Beautiful!. This beautiful triumphal arch connects Praca de Commercio which is the Commerce Square with Rua Augusta, a lovely pedestrian shopping area full of cafes, shops, and bakeries. Great photo ops. abound in this area. Don't forget to check it out day and again at night when lit up. We did not realize that we could have gone to the top of the arch. However, there are many opportunities throughout the city for great views.
Very beautiful. Imposible not to see. It´s in the center, very close to the shopping streets.Near the Commerce Square. Metro Station: Rossio (Line Green)

great views and short queues. We stumbled upon the entrance to this attraction by accident after hours. In the daytime I think we might have missed it due to the crowds around the arch. The entrance is just under the arch on the right hand side as you are walking into the city. Entrance is cheap (a few euro), and a lift takes you most of the way up the arch. You then have to walk a couple of short flights of narrow stairs, but a good 'traffic light' system ensures you don't meet anyone coming the other way. The views from the top of the arch are wonderful and give you a different perspective from those traditionally found from the Santa Justa elevator, or from the various miradouros around town. This view lets you look up into the castle, and straight down the lovely patterned cobblestoned Rua Augusta

Beautiful 360-view of Lisbon. The entrance beneath the Arch is very well organized with kind and knowledgeable staff. An elevator brings you quickly to the second floor from where, after you take a short walk up the steep stairwell, you arrive at the platform on the top of the Arch with magnificent sculptures and breathtaking view of the entire city, best of which is beautiful Praca de Comercio right beneath the Arch. You can also combine the ticket with the interactive Lisbon story in the Historical Museum right across the square.
Arco Triunfal . Beautiful arch. Near rossio plaza. Nice shops and pastelarias. Close to the waterfront. Not overly crowded once you pass through the arch.
Lovely people watching place. So picturesque,and a great place to people watch and drink coffee.Love the pedestrianised wide street

Panoramic view. Very good deal if you want to see Lisbon from above. A lift takes you to the upper floor, then 2 more little stairs (with signals to know if you can start going in the stairs or not - as they are narrow, it's impossible to go up if someone is coming down and vice-versa of course) Nice view, it's a pity that there are no seatings and no explanations of the panoramic view to help you recognising some buildings. We were alone when we went, it was during a working day so maybe that no tourists had arrived yet. Great view over the Praça do Commercio.
Nice view !!!. Enjoy the view of Lisbon from a special point !This arch is a really nice place to visit !!! Just look at the tagus and see all the surrounding involved , really interesting I believe
Wonderful monument!. Now you acn take the lift and see the views from the top of the arch! Absolutely fantastic! I love this arch !

A Nice Arch On The Way to Harbor Area. Downtown Lisbon is basically a huge shopping area. You either walk towards the water heading downhill, or walk up hill towards the Bell Towers & Castle. We first chose to walk toward the water. This arch, like many others in Europe, is impressive. The pictures from the backside toward the water look good, but not as good with the sun on the front looking up the street.(To Travel Is To Live)

Interesting sightseeing. It's a gateway for accessing the main square.Very interesting spot to watch from both sides, from Rua Augusta and from the Square.It makes you feel in the last century with all that structure around

Beautiful area. The area around the arc (Baixa i.e. the old town) is beautiful area with old historic buildings, a large lovely square (praca do comercio) with view over the bay, bars, restaurants and shopping.

Gateway to the city. This Arch is reminiscent of the more famous Arc de Triomphe in Paris and is a fitting entrance to the biggest open space in town, Praca do Comercio, which overlooks the river. It's situated at the southern end of Rua Augusta in the district of Chiado and welcomes you to the waterfront. If you're wandering around downtown, you can't and won't miss it, so keep roaming and you'll encounter a huge archway.

Do not miss the view from it. For a fee of Euro 2.50, the elevator takes you to the top of the Arco Triunfal. It is money well spent, the view is superb. You get a very good impression of the various neighbourhoods of Lisbon.
Fab architecture. The race is beautiful with fabulous architecture. It's at the end/start of one of the main streets filled with shops and bars. It is a must see and offers great views.
Beautiful architect work. Great arches on to all the main shopping down town, a must go!Amazing stores of all types, lots of restaurants and bars.

Good View, Great Architecture. This is a place you will probably end up even without planning to be here. The Arch is at the end of one of the main shopping streets and there is a large square that ends the street. Sometimes there will be festivals in that square. The Arch is of white stone or white stone exterior. You can imagine guests of the country coming through the port and entering at this point. After the main square there is a promenade and the Sea. People will sit here and relax at the cool breeze. While the structure itself will only take a few moments to enjoy there are a few cafes here that allow a nice place to sit and admire all the sights. While I did not enter and go to the top it is possible to do so.
Walking through history.... Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta is an amazing historical attraction worth the time and interest. It proudly showcases Portugal's history.

Great view. From the top I saw all the way until the other side of the river. It is also possible to see all the city around the hills.
Recommend it, but it's not free!

Go up and see it for yourself. After Castelo de São Jorge, this is probably one of the best views you'll get of Lisboa. Simply because it is right in front of the Tagus river and right above the largest square in the city. Plus you can see the Castle from there and Rua Augusta, which looks so charming with its Portuguese tiles and orange rooftops. It is worth the fee!
NICE VIEWS ONTO WATER. Large plaza with monument in centre, quite ornate. Very busy with tourists and the like. One of the must see tourist spots to tick off your list if so inclined
Beautiful. It is the Arch of Lisbon. Now, it is possible to visit and go to the top of the Arch. In Praca do Comercio, face to the river.

Arch du Triomphe, eat your heart out.. This arch is attached to a street full of cafes, delightful shops and imposing architecture. Additionally it faces one of the most beautiful waterfronts ever. Irresistible.
Spectacular view. Should been open for a long time, we have the sensation of old Lisbon days as we were Vasco da Gama or even Marquês de Pombal

History behind!!. One of the most touristy monuments in Lisbon, that I recommend to visit. Walking up the stairs, it's possble to have a beautiful view of Tejo River and part of the town. 2,5€ is charged for that.

The best place to start a tour in Lisbon. This monument takes us back to when Portugal was one of the most influential nations in the world, and was the gateway to show the greatness of the nation for those who were visiting it.Nowadays is a wonderful monument to see, and to begin the tour.

"Invest" the money and go upstairs. We went up there and you shouldn't hesitate to pay those 3€ for it. Especially around 6 o'clock when it starts getting dark it was absolutely lovely. You can really see how beautiful that city is when you stand up there.

Best views are from the square. This is located at the end of a great pedestrian street that opens onto a large plaza. There are several cafés along the street and the square where you can sit and people watch and enjoy the view of the arch and the surrounding buildings.

Fantastic views. A must.. This is finally renovated and Lisbon needed this spetacular lookout. It's easy to go up, fairly cheap and the views are fabulous. Also you can learn some history and see up close some magnificient statues.
I definitely reccomend

A MUST!. If you are visiting Lisbon, you must go to the heart of this wonderful city. It´s the most important and beautiful city that leaves you in Terreiro do Paço and the magnificent marble arch. Justo visit it!

Beautiful!. Needless to say we walked under this arch several times on our way to or from Praca de Comercio. The arch is reminiscent of the Arch de Triomphe in Paris. Great photo opportunities at or near the arch. The whole city is just a great big wonderful picture opportunity.
Excellent!. The view is amazing, the stairs to the top are interesting. The best time of the day to go is at sunset. Amazing light!

At one time or another you'll pass by- check out the views. We often found ourselves in Praca Comercio- it was a good starting point and we also would check in with the tourist information office(s) there. On our last day we finally went to the top- it wasn't very expensive and not many people. The Views were wonderful- and to think we almost missed them! Worth the quick trip up. Just be mindful that when you get to some stairs, see if the light is green or you can press the button so you have the right of way going up or down. We missed that information so wound up encountering people on the way down on the small circular stairs. There is an elevator but you also have to climb short flights of steps

Between Augusta and Comercio Square. It's a nice arch but I wouldn't say that it was a "must see." However, if you are in Lisbon, you will see it because it is between Rus Augusta and Comercio Square. If you want really good views of Lisbon, go to the Castle or the park in Barrio Alto.

A must see when in Lisbon. I did not realize you could go up to the top of the arch, but this review is for the Rua Augusta and Commerce Square. It was a nice walk down the Rua Augusta from Rossio Square once passing under the Arch you open up to the Square and the Tagus River. There are plenty of restaurants along the street and the square.
Lovely views and pretty cheap. Pretty nice views from both ends of the arch, and at only €2.50 entry it's worth going up. Wouldn't be the best views of Lisbon but nice all the same.
impressive. impressive arc at between the "Praça comercio" and the "Rua Augusta". One of the many impressive buildings in the city.

Easy Access, Amazing View. This arch is located probably at the most central area/street of Lisbon! It's a new attraction, since until some months ago you couldn't get inside. It offers an amazing view to the old part of the city, with all the roofs, and to the tiver. I'm a local, so I know the others viewing sights, and trust me: It is definitly worth the entrance (it costs 2,5€).

downtown. This Arch might be just a "simple" arch, but it is important for what it represents, and also cause it is the entrance to Augusta Street, which is full of great restaurants and will be one of the most pleasant walks you'll have in Lisbon

Fantastic view of the river Tajo and Praça do Comércio. Lisbon is a city that provides you fantastic views from different points and parts of the city. However this is the newest one and really interesting. Fee is not expensive so one can enjoy view of river Tajo, Praça do Comércio, Sao Jorge Castle, Rua Augusta, etc. and be so close to statues at the Triumphal Arch.

You can take great pictures!. The street is worth a visit. Lots of stores where you can buy anything, eat at the bakeries or small cafes with sidewalk tables.
Go down the street all the way and you will see the Arc. Pass through it and you'll be at Comércio Square.
nice panorama. open some months ago, from here you can see the old new part of Lisbon. Go up because it worth the visit
Entrance to the city... Walk down the entrance from either direction and it's just beautiful. The Arco facing the river has a lot of details and at night is spectacular
Charming. Walk and be surprised...get down to the praca do comercio and see the Tejo, the river that dreams of being the sea...
the best scenery view of Lisbon, 360º. the best scenery view of Lisbon, 360º, it is just recent but doing this is very nice, the view is just breathless

Nice place at the day. nice pedestrian street to walk with many shops and restaurants on both sides of the street during the day that ends at the arc. Am saying the day because during the night maybe when you walk maybe you will visit persons trying to sell you drugs!!! i "offered" from around 10 different persons along the street the only thing that you have to do is to ignore them and they will let you alone.

Take some photos. The square is huge so you get some very nice photo opportunities. Take some time to read up on the history and it will greatly enhance your visit to this square. I liked the open spaces and stood there imagining the time it took them to erect the Dom Jose statue and how the royals used to watch the bull fights from their balconies.
Nice arch. Not far fro our hotel so saw a few times. Nice part of the square it is beside. Good photo opportunities around here!
Nice Arch. Not far from our hotel and got some great pictures night and day of the arch and staue through the middle.

Impressive triumphal arch. On our flying visit, we found most of Lisbon rather scruffy and disappointing, but this arch was one of the highlights. Walking down from Rossio square towards the seafront, it is hard to miss. Vastly high yet narrow, it provides an obvious photo opportunity, especially after you cross into the open square beyond, by the sea (the Praca do Comercio.) We didn't realise you could ascend to the top of the arch, and didn't have time anyway, but according to other reviews, you can. This area is pleasant to walk around and is one of the touristy highlights. As for the rest of central Lisbon, well, it's just a shame about all the derelict and unkempt buildings, and all the graffiti everywhere. I hope Portugal begins to recover soon.

Surprise. I am portuguese, lived in Lisbon for years, keep going there often, and the city still surprises me. Seeing it from the rooftop off the arch give me a perspertive i never had and it was amazing. Dont miss it.

Another good view of Baixa. It is a very good place to go. There you have the best view of Rua Augusta and also a very nice view of Praça do Comércio with trams and restaurants.I suggest to go there during the day and look at the colours of Praça do Comércio with sun and also after the sunset to enjoy the night view.Also a very god place to take photos.

One of the most beautiful views over Lisbon. If you are visiting Lisbon, PLEASE, do not waste the opportunity to experience one of the best views of this unique city.Its a very recent attraction offered to the city visitors and one that you will simply love.Open from 09h00 to 19h00 at a 2,5 euros price.Free entry for children up to the age of 5.

Gorgeous at Sunset. Stunning, especially at sunset! This arc is reminiscent of the Arc de Triumph in Paris. Several art galleries and exhibits as well as shoppes and restaurants are surrounding this area. This was one of my favorite areas in Lisbon.
Nice restoration!. I was in Lisbon in May and the Arco was closed due to restoration. I returned in September and was delighted to find out that the observation area was open. Beautiful view!
Stunning. Such a beautiful arch, a mall on one side and a restaurant lined square the other. Great for some interesting photo ops

What a stunning arch!. This is an absolutely stunning triumphal arch, connecting Praça do Comércio with Rua Augusta.Taking a photo of the arch with the statue of King José I in its middle from Rua Augusta – is a photo-op must.

Feeling the history and the current financial situation. At the end of Rua Augusta, you see the Arco Triunfal and when doing so get reminded what a wealthy country Portugal once was, and when you see the people on the streets begging, the empty eyes watching you from stairwells and the people struggling to make a living, fighting the conditions you get a sense of Lisboa and Portugal today. A country in financial less flattering circumstances, but nevertheless fighting to survive. Hats off for the portuguese people!

A Beautiful Arch Leading to the Main Square of Lisbon. The arch leads into Lisbon's main square on one side and an excellent pedestrian/shopping mall on the other. The mall is full of cafes, restaurants and shops. There is a tempting patisserie on the corner of one of the intersecting roads. Don't miss seeing this incredible structure and checking out the mall.Tip: There is a tourist information booth in the square where you can buy the Lisbon Card, get free maps and have inquiries answered etc. There is also an information office located in one of the buildings in the square, where you can buy tickets to the story of Lisbon etc.

WOW view!. This is incredible place! Beautiful arch itself is one of the main decorations of the central Commerce Square. White accent between yellow buildings looks terriffic under bright Lisbon's sun! The viewpoint on the top of the arch lets you overlook both Glorious Square and charming Augusta Street from the best spot! It's been a surprise that there were just a few people and not the huge crowd as I expected.Just a 2 Euro fee is nothing in compare to the excitement you get there upstairs!

Ride the elevator to the top. After going there two days after the elevator inauguration only to find out it was "out service" due to a malfunction I managed to actually go back and go to the top of the arch. You'll get a good enough view, but from many other points of Lisbon you'll get a much better view for free.

GO - Beach, Views, Architecture!. Absolutely a must see. Just walk through quickly at the least! The arch itself is beautiful and so easy to get to. Plus, if you continue through the plaza, there is a cute little beach and lovely places for photographs!
