Plus there are several restaurants in the area and some flea market type tables selling things if you're interested in that. We went right around sunset and it was absolutely breathtaking. You can even take an elevator up to the top of the arch and see the view from there as well as the clock on the arch.
Amazing view. Outstanding view to S. Jorge Castle and Praça do Comercio. Lisbon is a breathtaking city and this new place is a must. Can see also the clock mechanism. The admission fee is fair.

The door. First place to go when arriving in Lisbon. Opening the city to the stores, restaurants, bars and it all. In front of the big entrance of the Ships from longtime. Good place to imagine the time of Navegation.

Brandnew viewing point.. The Arch was renovated, finished on the 10th August. Inside lift goes to the top, from where is a breathtaking view to the Comercio, the Tejo, the city center, the Rua Augusta. You can see the antique structure of the big clock, which is really very interesting.

Nice gateway, pictures in abundance. Impressive and very nice to see, located exactly on the Praca do Comercio at the end of Rua Augusta, of course it isn't an attraction that takes your breath away but in the context it is interesting both for arch itself and especially for the beautiful surrounding where it is located.

The gateway to the downtown, although still under renovation. We didn't spend more than a moment gazing up, trying to imagine what the Arco, another of the Marques de Pombal's creations, might look like under all the scaffolding. But then looking up Rua Augusta there are so many nice shops, cafes, etc. So if the Praca is a bit disappointing right now since it is under renovation, not far away there is lots to command the attention.

Still under renovations. Its still worth it since the surounding plaza is still very nice. We did plenty of shopping in the area. Tried to get some info as to when it would be finished and got no responses worth officially reporting

Under renovation. We enjoyed the shopping. The people watching and picture taking here. There is no traffic on the road except at intersections and it is mostlly a few cars. Some discount shopping, some ceramics, tourist trap restaurants, and beautiful hilly surrounding on all side except one - near the waterfront.

just an arch. This arch is at the end of Rua Augusta the main street in Lisbon, and which now is pedonal pass the arch and you enter a great square a lots of café and small restaurants, on the two side buildings several exhibitions are held. Marquis de Pombal is the author of this new rebuilt Lisboa after the earthquake in 1755. You will be able to climb up when the recontruction is complete as they say. The view will be fabulous. On sundays below the arch you can see a sort of flea market for old books

Repairs. This arch is currently completely enveloped in repair covers and cannot be seen at all. It appears that the work on it will take some considerable time so I would advise anyone to check before expecting to enjoy this

Nice Arch. I think is beatyful because is in the middle of the downtown, so, from the Arch you can see all the peolpe walking around and drinking coffee, in their own world.Is a good framework for a picture.

Schedule it on your trip.. A beautiful monument of Comércio Square. Buit to celebrate the city reconstruction after the 1755 earthquake. In ther area, slaves were sold during the empire. The area has many restaurants with outdoor seating and several shops. It's something like the Arc de Triomphe as it welcomes the tourists.

Iconic monument in Lisbon!. Built to commemorate the city's reconstruction after the 1755 earthquake. It has six columns (some 11 m high) and is adorned with statues of various historical figures. Originally designed as a bell tower, the building ultimately transformed into elaborate arch within more than century-long delays. Next year will be cleaned and will be allowed to visit the upper part of the arch, looking forward to do it!

Great, night and day. One of the Icons of the city, the Arco makes a great visit and one of the best spots for pictures of your visit to Lisbon. It is situated in the begining of Rua Augusta, a commerce street woth no cars, good shops and nice esplanades, that connects Praca do Comercio (with recent improvements, new restaurants and very nice esplanades) to Rossio, another great plaza in the city. Great pics any time, the illumination in the night time is something special also.Enjoy!
Beautiful. This is a beautiful view into the river. It is easy to find in the Rossio area. You can't miss it. Take a walk through to the park.

A window over the river. Everyday one can find lots of people taking pictures along Rua Augusta (one of the pedestrian streets), using "Arco Triunfal da Rua Augusta" as a frame for the equestrian statue (King Jose I) and the river. The arch itself is a monumental work of sculpture constructed to comemorate city's reconstruction of the heavy earthquake occurred in 1755. Its magnificence comes from cornice's height (30 m) above which stays the feminine figure of Glory (7 meters tall) rewarding Value and Genius

Beautiful and historic. One of Lisbon landmarks, the Arch is very beautiful and from there you can visit Terreiro do Paço and walk near the river, or you can go to Rua Augusta and visit a lot of shops. There are also many restaurants and cafes nearby.
